title: Technical Analyst
description:
With so much going on, it's a great time to join our Customer Interaction team.


Customer demands are constantly evolving, therefore it's vital we use what we learn to continuously improve.

As a Technical Analyst, you’ll play a critical role in analysing our data and processes and driving strategic initiatives that enhance our efficiency and overall performance. You’ll ensure that all projects are delivered on time and in budget.

You’ll also be a fantastic communicator, ready to liaise with a range of people from internal teams to external Business Partners, and strike up positive relationships with your manager, who will rely on your knowledge and expertise to make well-informed business decisions.

We do things our own way at Aldi. But whatever we're doing, we must be getting it right. With a wave of impressive sales figures behind us, we're opening new stores at lightning speed. And to keep on top of that wave, our customer interaction teams have to do something pretty special to keep our customers coming back for more.


With so much going on, it's a great time to join our Customer Insights team. The Customer Insights Team are responsible for the customer definition, providing customer analysis, reporting and insight, whilst promoting a data driven culture. Ensuring the business has the data to support their decision making.

Putting the customer at the heart of our decision making is a central pillar in the Aldi strategy and building this customer knowledge is an essential component to developing the long-term business success.


As a Customer Insight Analyst, you will use your experience to build and understand customer profiles using data-driven methodologies, champion the customer view, and providing valuable insights to boost our customers' experiences with Aldi. The successful candidate with champion the identification of the customer and the value the understanding brings to the wider business


You’ll also be a fantastic communicator, ready to liaise with a range of people from internal teams to external Business Partners, and strike up positive relationships with your manager, who will rely on your knowledge and expertise to make well-informed business decisions.


You’ll need to keep calm under pressure and have excellent communication and organisational skills. In true Aldi style, you’ll have plenty of freedom to use your initiative and drive change.


This role requires a candidate who has experience working in a Customer Insight capacity, either directly for a large retailer or through agency. The ideal candidate will have experience producing customer personas and profiles by aggregating business data such as Adobe Analytics behaviour data and transactional data.


If you’re looking for a career with a business that means more to it’s colleagues, join #TeamAldi today!


Your New Role


Customer Insight & Research

  • Producing Customer 360 degree view, through CDP solutions, enabling ALDI to understand their customer and their needs, in order to drive the right change business wide using data
  • Analysis of Adobe Analytics data via the platform, or through CDP aggregated with other data
  • Analysis and insight driven from customer data for customer segmentation, supporting marketing departments to deliver a more personalised customer experience
  • Deliver insight to management across the business on who ALDI customers are and how you can engage them
  • Lead & deliver in-house qualitative & quantitative research studies
  • Procure and manage external third party and agency customer research
  • Proactively identify opportunities to add additional value through understanding the customer
Presenting & Promoting
  • Drive the continuous improvement of analytics capabilities within the business
  • Proactively driving change through the business based on consumer needs through research and customer understanding
  • Champion holistically understanding the ALDI customer.
Collaboration
  • Collaboration Nationally and Internationally with other Insight and Research Teams to drive best practice
  • Support other CI Department management teams in understanding the ALDI customer, to better serve them through their channels
  • Work collaboratively with other departments who manage data or have data requirements, to support them in achieving their objectives
  • Work in monthly sprints, self-managing capacity and prioritisation using JIRA software

About You


  • Previous experience of working in an Insight, Research, or Customer Analytics role or through agency
  • Previous experience working with Web Analytics such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics, utilising data to understand customers for segmentation purposes Adobe Analytics for customer segmentation purposes
  • Strong communication and organisational skills, and high attention to detail
  • The ability to collaborate with the business teams to understand their priorities to help identify and deliver solutions in a timely fashion
  • Ability to proactively work towards challenging deadlines through multitasking and resilience
  • Ability to naturally develop relationships, communicate, engage and influence at all levels
  • Good understanding and experience of research techniques and methodologies
  • Advanced excel skills, experience working with and analysing data
  • Experience working in Tableau or similar BI tool.
  • Good knowledge of customer analytics and KPI's such as CLV, retention and loyalty
  • Customer Data Platform (CDP) experience
  • Experience working in a data or analytical function for a multi- or omni-channel retailer.
What you'll get in Return

  • Salary starting from £52,985 rising to £61,030
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • In office flexi-time
  • Pension scheme
  • Private employee medical insurance after 4 years
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • Access to MyBenefits, where you can find a wide range of benefits, including our bike to work scheme, shopping and cinema discounts, health cash plan, a FREE will, travel and discounted gym memberships, as well as a host of benefits to support your financial and wellbeing needs.
  • Access to a free,24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)

Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect.

If you’re looking for a career that gives you more, apply today!

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
POSITION: Senior Client Facing Data Analyst

Reporting To: Client Delivery Manager

Location: Rugby

Salary: £32,000 - £35,000 based on experience

Closing date for applications: 3rd March 2024

Applications, including your cv and a covering letter explaining your suitability for this role, should be submitted via Indeed.

No agencies please

Lorax EPI are looking to recruit a Senior Client Facing Data Analyst to their growing team. Working at the forefront of our Client Delivery Team, you will be responsible for providing time-critical data driven reports using our in-house software platform, ENVI™. Alongside your day-to-day data analytics, you will be interacting with a large portfolio of high-profile companies providing excellent customer service.

Who We Are

Lorax EPI is at the forefront of the product stewardship sector, with a passionate team of over 50 professionals based in Rugby, Warwickshire. Established in 2014, we are dedicated to transforming the landscape of environmental compliance through our innovative cloud software solutions and expert consulting services. Our work empowers companies worldwide to navigate and simplify the complexities of environmental regulations, including packaging legislation, plastics taxes, and Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) regulations.

As a Certified B Corporation® since 2022, Lorax EPI is committed to the highest standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where every team member is valued, respected, and has the opportunity to contribute to our mission.

Our Staffing Blueprint

We are a team of dynamic, motivated, and environmentally conscious individuals who are passionate about making a difference. If you thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment, and are eager to tackle the challenges of environmental compliance with cutting-edge technology, Lorax EPI is the perfect place for you.

To be considered for this role, you need at least 5 years of experience within a client facing or data analyst role such as Account Management or Data Analyst.

In this role, you will be:

· Building & maintaining strong customer relationships with a portfolio of customers. Hosting online meetings with various stakeholders to review progress of their compliance commitments.

· Gather data from customers, ensuring its accuracy and relevance. Perform statistical analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.

· Load data into our in-house software platform, generating reports to tight deadlines.

· Clearly communicate data insights and recommendations to customers through presentations, reports and meetings.

· Provide solutions-based support to customers data needs.

· Working collaboratively with the wider Client Delivery team

· Contributing to revenue growth by upselling/uplifting customer contracts

· Work towards weekly KPI’s and monthly targets; both individually and as a team

We Offer

- A chance to be part of a mission driven Company.

- A dynamic, inclusive, and supportive work environment that values creativity, innovation, and diversity.

- Opportunities for professional growth and development within a growing company.

Additional Benefits

- Annual bonus based on employee and company performance.

- Hybrid working policy available after successfully completing probation.

- Enhanced workplace pension scheme

- Flexibility to buy or sell 5 days annual leave every year.

- Death in service benefit

- Access to the Help@hand employee assistance app.

- Volunteering day

- Company events

Join Us:

If you are ready to use your skills and passion to contribute to a more sustainable future, we want to hear from you. Apply today to become part of a team that values innovation, sustainability, and making a positive impact.

Selection Process

o CV and Covering letter submission via Indeed closes on 3rd March 2024.

o Preliminary telephone interviews will begin immediately w/c 19th February.

o Selection Process including final interviews will follow.

o Job offers will be made no later than March 2024.

o Lorax will review submissions throughout the application period and reserves the right to close the selection process early if a satisfactory candidate is identified.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £32,000.00-£35,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Free parking
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Referral programme
  • Relocation assistance
  • Unlimited paid holidays

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Performance bonus
  • Yearly bonus

Experience:

  • Client Facing Data Analyst: 5 years (required)

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Ability to Commute:

  • Rugby (required)

Work Location: In person

Application deadline: 03/03/2024

title: Technical Analyst
description:
With so much going on, it's a great time to join our Customer Interaction team.


Customer demands are constantly evolving, therefore it's vital we use what we learn to continuously improve.

As a Technical Analyst, you’ll play a critical role in analysing our data and processes and driving strategic initiatives that enhance our efficiency and overall performance. You’ll ensure that all projects are delivered on time and in budget.

You’ll also be a fantastic communicator, ready to liaise with a range of people from internal teams to external Business Partners, and strike up positive relationships with your manager, who will rely on your knowledge and expertise to make well-informed business decisions.

We do things our own way at Aldi. But whatever we're doing, we must be getting it right. With a wave of impressive sales figures behind us, we're opening new stores at lightning speed. And to keep on top of that wave, our customer interaction teams have to do something pretty special to keep our customers coming back for more.


With so much going on, it's a great time to join our Customer Insights team. The Customer Insights Team are responsible for the customer definition, providing customer analysis, reporting and insight, whilst promoting a data driven culture. Ensuring the business has the data to support their decision making.

In your Data & Analytics role, you’ll play a critical part in analysing data and processes to create a view of our customer, which will drive strategic initiatives that enhance our efficiency and overall performance.


You’ll have the opportunity to collaborate across the department, supporting teams to drive strategy through use of data, analytics and insights, enabling them to make well-informed business decisions. You’ll need to keep calm under pressure, have a passion for analysing complex information, and have excellent communication and organisational skills. In true Aldi style, you’ll have plenty of freedom to use your initiative and drive change.


This role requires a candidate with experience working with multiple large data sets using tools such as Tableau or Analytics for Office, analysing information to drive insights. The ideal candidate should be able to identify, define and analyse initiatives or business improvements, proposing solutions that work towards achieving business objectives.


If you’re looking for a career with a business that means more to it’s colleagues, join #TeamAldi today!

Your New Role

Data & Analytics

  • Analysis of project data, trend analysis, and hypotheses supporting future business decision making
  • Analysis of Business Performance to develop existing services, driving Insight and proposing solutions for improvements
  • Data gathering and aggregation from multiple sources including transaction data, onsite behaviour data, customer voice data, and business performance data
  • Data Visualisation and Dashboard building via Tableau or other software
  • Data investigation and reconciliation using data software or excel

KPI & Reporting

  • Competitor analysis and benchmarking
  • KPI development, monitoring, reporting
  • Customer Metric and Brand Metric definition, monitoring and analytics to drive improvement

Data-Driven

  • Presenting translation of data and relevant insights and recommendations to management, highlighting improvements, risks and opportunities appropriate for the audience
  • Promote a data driven culture throughout the Customer Interaction Department through proven analytics, presenting the value of data, and building networks cross department
  • Drive the continuous improvement of analytics capabilities within the business

Collaboration

  • Management of 3rd parties providing services and data, e.g. survey providers
  • Work in monthly sprints, self-managing capacity and prioritisation using JIRA software
  • Work collaboratively with other departments who manage data or have data requirements, to support them in achieving their objectives
  • Implementing processes and ways of working with other departments to ensure smooth delivery and managed expectations
  • Support in the creation of data governance, enabling data to be both secure and accessible for business decisions

About You


  • Previous experience of working in a data or analytical function.
  • Advanced excel skills, experience working with and analysing data.
  • Strong communication and organisational skills, and high attention to detail
  • The ability to collaborate with the business teams to understand their priorities to help identify and deliver solutions in a timely fashion.
  • Ability to proactively work towards challenging deadlines through multitasking and resilience.
  • Ability to naturally develop relationships, communicate, engage and influence at all levels.
  • Experience working in a data or analytical function for a multi- or omni-channel retailer.
  • Knowledge of various BI tools (such as Tableau SAP BO, Lumira, Web Intelligence and Analysis for Office, Alteryx).
  • Experience working in Tableau or similar BI tool.
  • Experience working with Adobe Analytics
  • Technical data aggregation expertise
  • Customer Data Platform (CDP) experience

What you'll get in Return

  • Salary starting from £52,985 rising to £61,030
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • In office flexi-time
  • Pension scheme
  • Private employee medical insurance after 4 years
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • Access to MyBenefits, where you can find a wide range of benefits, including our bike to work scheme, shopping and cinema discounts, health cash plan, a FREE will, travel and discounted gym memberships, as well as a host of benefits to support your financial and wellbeing needs.
  • Access to a free,24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)

Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect.

If you’re looking for a career that gives you more, apply today!

title: Data Scientist
description:
About The Role

Here at LloydsPharmacy Clinical Homecare, we are looking for a Head of Data Science and Analysis to join our growing team and be reporting into the Director of Commercial Finance. The Head of Data Science & Analysis is responsible for developing and translating the LPCH data strategy, leading and embedding the delivery of robust enterprise data and data driven insights to the business. You will lead, manage and monitor the availability, visibility and integrity of data across the business to drive data-led decision making. Additionally you will also ensure the ethical and responsible use of data, adhering to all data regulatory and legislative standards and expectations. The Head of Data Science & Analysis will promote and drive LPCH's data driven culture, identifying opportunities to continually improve awareness and use of tools and systems. Furthermore you will lead and manage the performance and potential of the financial data team.

Do you want to know if we are right for you? Sign up to one of our upcoming virtual drop-in sessions here and let us pitch ourselves to you!


Why LloydsPharmacy Clinical Homecare?

We have a lot to offer to not only the 100,000 patients we support, but also to our valued employees. LloydsPharmacy Clinical Homecare has a wide range of exciting opportunities for passionate professionals across nursing, patient services, compounding, pharmacy and warehousing. These roles come with fantastic benefits including:

  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Company bonus scheme
  • Outstanding training & development programmes
  • Up to £1200 refer a friend bonus
  • Full support from our employee assistance programme including a health and well-being app
  • Savings and discounts at multiple retailers through our rewards portal


About You

The ideal candidate is a highly qualified and experienced individual with a degree in computer science, math, or a science-based subject. They have a good working knowledge of relevant programming languages, including SQL and JAVA, and possess strong database design and coding skills and experience. They also have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as experience with data interrogation and analysis tools. You will have a proven track record of successfully engaging with and managing senior leader and stakeholder relationships, as well as excellent communication and presentation skills.
Additionally you will have strong influencing skills at multiple levels, including C-Suite and Senior Management, and will be able to translate and convey complex information to a range of Senior Leaders and multi-level stakeholders. The ideal candidate is driven and resilient, with a proven track record of achieving outcomes through collaboration and engagement. They are also able to manage and deliver challenging and conflicting priorities and timelines, and have excellent attention to detail.

title: Analyst
description:
Job Description


We are AMS. We are a global total workforce solutions firm; we enable organisations to thrive in an age of constant change by building, re-shaping, and optimising workforces. Our Contingent Workforce Solution (CWS) is one of our service offerings; we act as an extension of our clients' recruitment team and provide professional interim and temporary resources.


We are looking for multiple Analysts for a 12-month contract based in Derby on behalf of our globally respected client who develop cutting-edge technologies that deliver clean, safe and competitive solutions to meet the planet's vital power needs. This is a hybrid role with three days on site.

Job description

You will have regular interaction with all levels of Civil Aerospace Large Engine Programmes, Customer Regional Teams, the Services Organisation, the Finance Organisation and will have an in depth understanding of how the Aftermarket business is managed.

As an Analyst you will be responsible for:

  • Forecasting TotalCare, Flex, SelectCare and FPOH business returns, liaising with multiple different functions across the business to complete this activity.
  • Creating and monitoring engine overhaul / spare parts sale forecasts to support both the Parts forecast and MRO load forecast.
  • Identifying opportunities to improve the accuracy and efficiency of the business forecasting process.
  • Creating and monitoring engine overhaul forecasts.
  • Update contracts - from the project buy off, pulling data from engineering, operations, commercial and feeding into different processes.
  • Provide financial summaries at end of the process.

What we require from the candidate:

  • Good analytical, communication, presentation, negotiation and project management skills are required.
  • A sense of business acumen together with good judgement and effective planning skills.
  • Ability to cope with high levels of ambiguity.
  • Ability to work autonomously.
  • An effective problem solver, able to act decisively to implement optimal solutions.
  • Experience of working with a variety of stakeholders.
  • Microsoft Dynamics and Excel experience
  • Degree qualified or equivalent - desirable.
  • This role would be suitable for someone from a Data Analyst, Procurement Analyst, Financial Analyst, Commercial Analyst or similar type role.

Next steps

If you are interested in applying for this position and meet the criteria outlined above, please click the link to apply and we will contact you with an update in due course.

Please note that due to recent changes in Off Payroll (IR35) legislation, our client only operates with contractors that operate via a PAYE or Umbrella model. We are unable to accept applications from candidates wishing to operate under their own Limited Company.

AMS, a Recruitment Process Outsourcing Company, may in the delivery of some of its services be deemed to operate as an Employment Agency or an Employment Business.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Nottingham University Business School

Location:
Jubilee Campus

Salary:
Salary offers will be from £70922 per annum, pro rata and within our professorial range, depending on knowledge, skills and experience.

Closing Date:
Tuesday 12 March 2024

Reference:
SOC031624

Nottingham University Business School is an international leader in responsible business, management and finance education and research at one of the UK’s most successful universities. With campuses in the UK, China and Malaysia, the school is accredited by AACSB, EQUIS and AMBA at all its three locations. For more information please see http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/business.

As a Professor at N/Lab in the Marketing Department you will provide leadership, collegiality and management across the areas of Research and Knowledge Exchange (RKE), Education and Student Experience (ESE) and University/academic service, administration, and good citizenship. In addition, you will engage in high quality research and contribute to teaching on the range of programmes offered by the School at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels.

You will have a PhD (or equivalent) supported by extensive, high-level research and teaching experience in a relevant area, together with a sustained track record of publishing in internationally excellent peer-reviewed journals in Computational analytics and/or related areas. In addition, you will have an established and widely recognised excellence and reputation in Analytics and AI specialist subject areas amongst peers nationally and internationally, with experience of Digital Business.

This is a part-time (29 hours per week), permanent post, available from 1 September 2024.

Informal enquiries may be addressed to Professor Jillian Rickly, email jillian.rickly@nottingham.ac.uk. Please note that applications sent directly to this email address will not be accepted.

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
Bringing that feel-good energy.

We're the newest face amongst the E.ON group of companies. E.ON Next is all about creating a sustainable future, now. We're moving our energy in the right direction, one little big step at a time. Join us in our mission to bring feel-good energy.
We’re also here to make this whole energy thing way easier for our customers. Like, really easy. That means providing exceptional service and using state-of-the-art tech to do it.
As a Pricing Analyst you will be Identifying and delivering pricing to drive the right commercial and customer outcomes for our Residential and SME base. Ensuring that price positions are delivered in line with, acquisition, renewal, channel and segments strategies.

A taste of what you'll be doing

Modelling and analysing impacts of pricing decisions and maintaining and developing the pricing platform. You will work to meet the strategic aims of the business - cost and risk reflective whilst maintaining a competitive pricing position within the market.

It is imperative that you work closely with the other members of the analytical & data community, particularly within the commercial team, EEM team and the data team, to ensure that the right commercial decisions are taken.

Are we the perfect match?

We know what’s important to us at E.ON Next, we’re looking for the brightest and best to join our team and create the right culture to be the best. You could be just what we’re looking for if these sound like you –
  • Previous experience within in a Pricing or Commercial analytical role, working with large, complex data sets and ability to summarise and present commercial insights from the data.
  • Commercial acumen combined with excellent analytical skills.
  • Tableau and Python knowledge would be an advantage.
  • Strong communication skills, able to translate detailed analysis into simple, digestible insight & recommendations suitable for senior leadership.
  • SME and Residential pricing experience would be an advantage.
  • Experience of working cross-functionally and the ability to build strong relationships.
  • You can think customer as well as commercial outcomes.
Here’s what else you need to know
  • We’ll have regular team socials and lively team chats
  • Competitive salary
  • Location - Nottingham with travel to our other sites when required.
  • Working environment: Flexible hybrid working – a blend of in the office for 2-3 days a week and at home the remainder.
  • 26 days holiday plus bank holidays each year – this includes a guaranteed day of for your birthday off if you want it.
  • A generous pension scheme.
  • The chance to choose from our award-winning Flexible Benefits package which includes the option to buy up to 10 days holiday a year.
  • We’ve exciting opportunities for everyone to develop their talent at E.ON. Our open access, inclusive talent networks provide networking, learning and development for all, building your skills, qualifications, and capabilities throughout your career.
  • For all successful candidates. Due to the nature of this role your employment will be subject to a basic DBS (Disclosure Barring Service) check being carried out by ourselves via a 3rd party service provider

We’re committed to equal opportunities and actively promote a diverse and inclusive working environment, and fairness for everyone.

We realise the best people bring their energy at different times, so we’re happy to talk flexible working. We offer a range of flexible working options, including full time, part time, job share, remote working and variable start and finishing times.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
BI Analyst

Job details

Posted 13 February 2024
Salary £28000 - £31000 per annum
LocationCoventry
Job type Permanent
Discipline Development, Data
ReferenceMT-164
Contact NameMatt Trought

Job description

BI Analyst

(The client won’t accept anyone who is on a Visa)

Salary: £31,000
Location: Coventry (On site 4 days a week)

BI Analyst / Data Analyst / MI Analyst / Business Intelligence / SQL / T-SQL / Excel / Coventry

A fantastic opportunity has come up to work for an exciting organisation located in Coventry as they look to expand their Data team.

They are looking for a Junior BI Analyst to help support the business with resolving queries and issues that the teams are experiencing. In this challenging yet exciting role you will use your SQL skills to investigate and troubleshoot problems and resolve them. They are looking for a proactive person who is a self-starter.

They are looking for a BI Analyst who has enthusiasm and commitment to excel in their IT department. A keen eye for detail, a highly structured approach, a personal drive to succeed and the ability to learn and grow are all key assets you will possess. They are a company that believes in their staff and will always back you in terms of support, personal development and progression.

From a technical standpoint, you will be using an advanced and practical knowledge of SQL, as well as expert usage of Excel to deliver and present results (e.g. advanced formulas, pivot tables).

Essential skills and experience:
  • Knowledge of MS SQL Server; T-SQL is essential
  • Writing SQL queries
  • Excellent Microsoft Excel skills
  • Good problem identification and solving skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills
  • Ability to manage time effectively, meet deadlines and prioritise
  • Minimum of 1 years’ experience in a similar role
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Applying for the opportunity:

If you like the sound of this opportunity, and you feel you have the required skills requested for the role. Please apply, and someone will contact you within 24 hours if you meet the requirements of the opportunity.

BI Analyst / Data Analyst / MI Analyst / Business Intelligence / SQL / T-SQL / Excel / Coventry

title: Warehouse Lead
description:
No matter where you are in your career – or where you want to be – we’re here to create a great place to work where you can grow, perform and love what you do. At Cromwell, we’re all individuals, with unique backgrounds and personalities. But we have one thing in common: delivering exceptional service for our customers. And we do this through our purpose of Keeping Industry Working.

Role Responsibilities:

Cromwell Tools is seeking an Analyst Team Leader to join our Finance department in Wigston, Leicester. In this elevated role, you will report to the Head of FP&A and lead a team of Analysts. You will coach and train Analysts within the team, working on analytics to support big business decisions and putting insights in the hands of the teams that need it. Your primary focus will be on ensuring the delivery of high-quality data feeds, insights, and analytics, while maintaining a single source of truth for data within the organisation. Proficiency in SQL-based systems, particularly PostgreSQL, is preferred.
Key Responsibilities:

  • Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of Data Analysts, fostering their growth, and ensuring they meet individual and team goals.
  • Collaborate with other Analysts and the Data Science team Working together on larger data projects as well as supporting the immediate business needs.
  • Information Requests: Manage and prioritise day-to-day requests for data and information from various departments within the organisation, ensuring timely and accurate responses.
  • Legacy Reporting Systems: Oversee the decommissioning of legacy reporting systems, working with the team to migrate relevant data and reports to more efficient platforms.
  • Data Quality: Establish and maintain data quality standards and processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data feeds and reports.
  • Single Source of Truth: Ensure that data used across the organisation is consistent and aligns with a single instance of truth, reducing data discrepancies.
  • Coaching and Training: Coach and train analysts within the business to enhance their analytical skills and understanding of data practices.
  • Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, to identify opportunities for improving data management and reporting processes.

Preferred skills and qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred).
  • Proven experience in data analysis and team leadership roles.
  • Proficiency in data visualisation tools, with expertise in Power BI.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks and projects.
  • Knowledge of data governance and data quality best practices.
  • Experience with SQL-based systems, particularly PostgreSQL, is a plus.
  • Experience with data migration and legacy system decommissioning is a plus.

About Cromwell

Cromwell has been around for over 50 years, supplying an unrivalled choice of cutting tools, power tools, hand tools and safety equipment into all industries, professions and trades. We offer next day delivery or collection from our nationwide branch network, supported by an overnight UK logistics operation. Our team of over 1500 people are proud to be keeping industry working.

As a leader in B2B and B2C e-commerce, our Digital team is responsible for driving digital multi-channel solutions that make it easy for customers to deal with us.

Our Agile teams make data-driven decisions to ensure that our customers receive the biggest benefits, more frequently. You’ll have the freedom and autonomy to try new things, challenge the status quo and embrace curiosity.

And our data team, comprised of awesome data analysts, data engineers and data scientists, is leading the data landscape within Cromwell, building creative solutions and delivering key insights and valued reporting.

We’re all individuals, yet we’re very much one united team. We treat everyone fairly – regardless of gender, sexual orientation, background, age or disability – and give everyone opportunities for new and varied experiences. Inclusion means not just accepting people for who they are, but showing respect and making adjustments to help people and remove all barriers; it’s about creating a culture where everyone is respected, empowered and able to realise their full potential.

Cromwell is an Equal Opportunity Employer


    Location:Leicester (Head Office)
    Working Hours per week:40.25
    Contract Type:Permanent - Full Time

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Location
Salary
Posted on
Reference

Leicester
£55000 - £65000 12/02/2024
NJR14568

DESCRIPTION

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst
Location : Leicester
Working Arrangement: 2-3 day in office, hybrid
Salary: 55-65k + discretionary bonus and various benefits

One of the UK\'s leading providers of pension consultancy and wealth management services based is currently undergoing a transformation to build a robust in-house analytics team to handle the integration, data modelling, prediction, and inference of all our data analytics, information, and systems.

If you\'re looking to join a growing company with some ambitious plans in place for this year and beyond, then this is the role for you!

MORE ABOUT THE ROLE:

A key to the role will be managing and delivering automation across the Finance team, by using automation, finance, and analytic systems. You will be expected to retrieve and build strong data models, manage current models, and assist in automating workflows to drive operational performance.

In addition, the successful candidate will also be required to use data to analyse and drive growth across the business. You will play a pivotal role in leveraging data-driven insights to support strategic financial decision-making.

REQUIREMENTS:

\" qualified ACCA/CIMA/ACA
\" strong experience delivering finance transformation using data and systems
\" highly proficient in ERP Dynamics 365 (Business Central)
\" desirable experience in CCH Tagetik
\" exceptional financial modelling, Excel and analytical skills
\" proficient coding ability including SQL, DAX and working knowledge of Azure Pipelines
\" highly diligent with an eye for detail and impeccable presentational skills.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

As a Senior Data Analyst role within the Finance team, you will act as a strategic influencer. The successful applicant will produce consistent and consolidated data models whilst delivering data driven insights to the group, to drive impactful decisions and enhance the overall financial health of the organisation.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

\" develop and implement a comprehensive automation strategy for all finance processes
\" collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyse workflows, identify automation, and establish a roadmap for continuous process improvement
\" monitor the effectiveness of automated processes, troubleshooting issues, and implement enhancements
\" provide training and support to finance team members on the use of automation tools
\" collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to maintain a robust and stable data model that supports financial reporting and analysis
\" conduct regular audits of finance systems, ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements
\" implement data governance policies to maintain the quality and security of financial data
\" utilise advanced data analysis techniques to explore financial data, identifying trends, anomalies, and areas for improvement
\" use expert financial modelling and accounting knowledge to create accurate and insightful financial forecasts and models
\" conduct thorough financial and data analyses to support strategic decision-making, presenting findings in a clear and actionable format
\" collaborate with finance and business teams to understand their data requirements and provide customised analyses to meet their needs
\" drive data exploration initiatives, uncovering opportunities for cost reduction, revenue enhancement, and overall financial optimisation

NJR 14568

title: Business Analyst
description:
Summary

Job Reference:
224901BR

Nottingham Support Office

Permanent

37.5 hours per week

Our application process

Junior Business Analyst

About the role:

Operational Analytics team supports the business to make smarter data-based decision. We focus on agile working, continuous improvement and personal development. As the business becomes more focused on data and technology, we evolve too with more complex data utilisation and providing analytics-backed value.

You need to understand the business, their needs and requirements to be able to provide different outputs impacting the bottom line. e.g. Data, Reporting, Analytics, Insight etc. Utilising problem-solving mindset and technical expertise in tools such as Power BI, Azure DataBricks, etc.

Become a subject matter expert for part of the business and support the business with driving change, commercial decisions and drive on customer self-serve capabilities.

  • Work with the business to understand the business and deliver reporting, analytics and insight expectations
  • Build, maintain and manage stakeholder relations across business functions
  • Perform data ETL from various sources / systems into Power BI / Azure DataBricks
  • Working in an Agile manor provide accurate, cross business functions aligned outputs
  • Maintain live infrastructure for data pipeline, reporting and analytics
  • Drive capabilities development while instilling a self-serve culture across business
  • Demonstratable out of the box thinking, Commercial acumen and an eye for opportunities when looking at potential problems

What you’ll need to have:

  • Advanced knowledge and technical experience with Power BI reporting and analytics (along with other MS Packages e.g. Power Automate)
  • Stakeholder relationship management
  • Curious, analytical problem-solving mindset
  • Commercial acumen to understand raw data and present the story as output
  • Experience of organising and setting up data for advanced analytics models
  • Ability to map processes and document data and models/reporting
  • Working knowledge of Azure DataBricks and programming languages like Python, SQL, etc…
  • Be able to simplify and explain, complex technical models and outputs to key business stakeholders

It would be great if you also have:

  • Expertise in other systems / tools such as Alteryx, R, etc..
  • Working knowledge of commercial business areas like Sourcing, Product quality, sustainability, etc..
  • Project management

Hybrid Working:

We offer our Support Office team members a flexible, hybrid working approach based upon empowerment, accountability, care, and trust, which includes a balanced mix of remote and office-based working - this will be discussed with you as part of the application process.

About No7 Beauty Company:

No7 Beauty Company is more than just one voice, we are five iconic brands - No7, Liz Earle, Soap & Glory, Botanics and Sleek MakeUP. We believe in creating the best in beauty for everyone - we’re innovators with a passion for challenging perceptions with ground-breaking products, proven results, and positive impact. We’ve built a reputation on scientific innovation, whilst being environmentally sustainable and socially responsible. We’re an equal opportunity employer and no matter where you work in No7 Beauty Company, you’ll be empowered to be your authentic self - we share a culture where diversity, equity and inclusion are at the centre of everything we do. Join us and together we can achieve more. Find out more here.

Our benefits:

  • Boots Retirement Savings Plan
  • Enhanced maternity/paternity/adoption leave pay
  • Discretionary annual bonus
  • Generous employee discounts

Flexible benefits scheme including discounted gym membership, life assurance, activity passes, holiday buying and much more.

We have a great range of benefits in addition to the above that go beyond salary and offer flexibility to suit you;(all rewards and benefits are subject to change and eligibility). *Please note, any salary estimates given on third-party sites are not provided or endorsed by Boots and may not be accurate.

What’s next:

If your application is successful, our in-house recruitment team will be in touch to arrange an interview and to answer any initial questions you have. If you have not been successful on this occasion, you’ll be notified by email.

We are always open to discussing possible flexible working options and what this may look like for you, including job share and reduced hours. If you require additional support as part of the application and interview process, we are happy to provide reasonable adjustments to help you to be at your best.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Senior Business Data Analyst

Circa £55,000

Coventry


Who we are?


At LEVC we have been transformed from a traditional vehicle manufacturer of the iconic black cab, into a modern electric vehicle company with high performing tech. We operate a green global footprint, with offices and operations across Europe and key overseas markets. The TX electric taxi heralded a new generation of personal transport, bringing zero-emissions-capable operation to cities around the world.

Why work at LEVC?

Our talented team are dedicated to driving green transport solutions that will accelerate the journey to cleaner cities. With our principle ‘Sustainable Innovation’ at the heart of everything we do, we’re proud of what we’ve achieved already and excited to bring and develop talent into the EV industry. 2024 promises to be another exciting year with all the foundations in place to embark on an ambitious growth journey.

About the role

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting and analysing complex data sets to provide actionable insights for our organisation. You will work closely with various teams to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. The role requires a strong analytical mindset, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.


Collect, clean, and validate large datasets from diverse sources

Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies

Create clear and compelling visualisations, dashboards, and reports to communicate insights

Develop and implement statistical models for forecasting and predictive analysis

Design and maintain databases and data systems.


Experience to succeed


Strong background in a Data Analyst or similar role

Has proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages

Experience with data visualisation tools (Power BI essential)

Strong knowledge of statistical concepts and methods

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Experienced supporting a sizeable, fast-moving business

Experience with automotive manufacturing or EVs is a bonus


What we can offer you

Competitive salary


25 days’ annual leave plus bank holidays

Hybrid working available between base location/home (3 days in the office and 2 days working from home)

Life insurance, cycle to work scheme, and a salary sacrifice pension scheme

Health and wellbeing support, including Medicash health care scheme, Employee Assistance Programme, available 24/7 365 days and network of mental health first aiders.

Salary extras giving you discounts across various retailers (e.g supermarkets, eating out, and leisure activities.)

Modern offices with free parking and EV charging

Offices include use of onsite gym (Ansty location), subsidised canteens, regular companywide events

Dedicated Learning & Development team help you to unlock your potential through technical & behavioural training. Oh, and did we mention you can get access to LinkedIn Learning too!

At LEVC, whatever your role, you truly have the opportunity to join a team that helps you perform at your best.

title: New Home Sales Consultant
description:
new
Ref: 12022023VSNFI4_1707731123

BI Consultant - Azure - Home-based

England

  • £40,000 to £60,000 GBP
  • Consultant Role
  • Level: Mid-level

Job description

BI Consultant - Azure - Home-based

12022023VSNFI4_1707731123

I'm working with a small and growing family-run Microsoft Gold Partner Consultancy, who are looking for a Business Intelligence professional with a strong background in Data Warehousing to join their team on a remote basis (with occasional travel to client site and team get-togethers).

The ideal candidate will come from a strong Business Intelligence Development background, with a track-record of designing and developing data warehousing solutions, and will have a keen interest in Azure technologies - ideally you will already have some experience with Azure technologies such as Azure Data Factory.

You'll work across the entire client project lifecycle, from requirements gathering through to solution design, development, implementation and providing end-user training and support. You'll do this as part of a close-knit technical team, working on varied projects which may include Power BI implementation, Data Engineering and Azure Data Migration, to give only a few examples.

With increased demand from their clients for Azure Data Platform services, this role would give you the opportunity to really develop skills with tools such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Synapse Analytics and Databricks!

As such, this would be a brilliant opportunity for a seasoned BI Developer to take a step into Consultancy, and work on some really varied and cutting-edge projects as part of a truly supportive and progressive company.

Requirements:

We are looking for most (but not necessarily all) of the below experience:

  • Advanced SQL & T-SQL development skills
  • Data Warehouse design & development experience
  • SSIS - experience designing packages
  • SSAS - experience designing Tabular Models
  • Power BI - experience designing reports with use of DAX
  • Any experience with Azure would be beneficial
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

Benefits:

  • Salary up to £60,000 depending on your specific experience
  • 25 days holiday & bank holidays
  • Private health cover
  • Workplace pension - 3% employer and 5% employee contribution
  • Support towards Microsoft Certifications



Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a DBS and Credit Check.

Nigel Frank are the go-to recruiter for Power BI and Azure Data Platform roles in the UK, offering more opportunities across the country than any other. We're the proud sponsor and supporter of SQLBits, Power Platform World Tour, the London Power BI User Group, Newcastle Power BI User Group and Newcastle Data Platform and Cloud User Group. To find out more and speak confidentially about your job search or hiring needs, please contact me directly at v.simpson@nigelfrank.com

title: Senior Business Data Analyst 12 months FTC
Data Analyst
description:
DATA ANALYST APPRENTICE


LET’S CUT STRAIGHT TO IT


Taking care of ‘one of life’s essentials’ – it’s our purpose and we want you to be part of it. Supplying wholesome drinking water, treating wastewater, and recycling this back to the environment responsibly is no mean feat. We serve around 8 million people across the Midlands and Wales and unlike other businesses, our delivery is non-negotiable. It’s a matter of life.

Many of our employees are also our customers, so we truly take pride in what we do! Employing people from across our communities and beyond, Severn Trent is an exciting and inclusive place to work – a place where you can be curious, can be ‘Wonderfully You’ and where you can truly make an impact to our environment, now and for future generations.


LET’S TELL YOU MORE


Apprenticeship Programmes are a great way to earn and learn! Our Apprentice Data Analyst Programme offers the perfect blend of personal and professional development, exposing you to the core of our business. Entering an Apprenticeship scheme with us involves working towards the role of a fully-fledged professional, earning a salary, whilst also being able to maintain a sense of academic achievement. At Severn Trent we provide the perfect mix between hands-on experience and a formal qualification, enabling our apprentices to make a real lasting difference to our customers and communities, not just for now, but far into the future.


You’ll be supported every step of the way, by your line manager and mentor. Responsibilities of businesses are changing rapidly; society increasingly expects that organisations should act responsibly not just to their shareholders but also to their wider stakeholders and the broader community. Working alongside either our Capital Delivery team or Workforce Planning & Optimisation Team, you’ll become a key component of virtually all types of business models where profit and growth are a means to an even greater end, such as protecting the environment and improving societal sustainability. You’ll help to innovate and drive ambitions for change and make these a reality that are embedded and implemented across Severn Trent.


HOW WILL THE PROGRAMME WORK


Standard


Data Analyst


Website

https://www.instituteforapprenticeships.org/apprenticeship-standards/data-analyst-v1-1


Apprenticeship Duration


24 months


Apprenticeship Level


Level 4


Locations


Severn Trent Centre, Coventry, West Midlands CV1 2LZ

Finham, Coventry, West Midlands CV3 6SD

Raynesway, Derby, Derbyshire DE21 7BE


Salary

£17,194


Provider/ F2F or Online

TDM / Online


ENTRY CRITERIA


Based on the level of this Apprenticeship Programme (Level 4 Foundation Degree) we require all candidates to have Level 3 qualifications (A-Levels, BTEC National, NVQ/SVQ Level 3, Level 3 advanced apprenticeship)


ROLE EXPECTATIONS POST APPRENTICESHIP


By the end of this programme, you will take up a Data Analyst role, where you will be able to put your skills to action


WHAT WILL YOU LEARN


  • How to access and analyse data from across the entire business. Using it to update existing dashboards and reports, as well as creating your own to meet any new requirements.
  • How to effectively clean, transform, join and validate data from multiple sources (including solving any problems that arise as part of that). Ensuring your data, visualisations, reports, and any conclusions you draw from them are accurate.
  • How to carry out analysis on key measures such as how effectively a team or project is performing right through to higher level company performance metrics that are reported the water regulatory body OFWAT
  • To build internal relationships that foster buy-in to existing and future initiatives.
  • To understand how to act ethically and how this thought process can be brought into everyday business practices.
  • How to analyse and identify Severn Trent’s opportunities and threats. Escalating any risks within your own team or processes if you find them


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


We want our employees to care and to have a genuine passion for what we do as a business. We need people who want to make a difference in providing a vital service to our customers, now and for the long-term.

We’d love you to be someone with…


  • A ‘can do’ attitude – willing to get stuck in, take accountability for decisions and actions and who takes pride in their work
  • A love of variety in a role and ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced working environment
  • Ability to quickly prioritise tasks and the initiative to dive head-first into problem solving.
  • No two days are the same on the front line and not every day goes to plan, so you’ll need to be quick on your feet to respond!
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working with multiple teams
  • Ability to analyse and interpret information and effectively communicate this to different team members and audiences
  • Curiosity to learn quickly in a reactive and dynamic working environment


HOW WE’LL REWARD AND CARE FOR YOU IN RETURN


It’s not just a job you’ll get here, you’ll get a career too. We have a range of benefits that reward and recognise great work and award-winning training to ensure you reach your potential. And we’ll also help you play your part in looking after the environment and the community in which we live.

With that in mind, here are just some of our favourite perks that you’ll get being part of the Seven Trent family:


  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays (and the ability to buy/ sell up to 5 days per year)
  • Annual bonus scheme (of up to £1,500, which is subject to eligibility)
  • Leading pension scheme – we will double your contribution (up to 15% when you contribute 7.5%)
  • Sharesave – the chance to buy Severn Trent Plc shares at a discounted rate
  • Dedicated training and development with our Academy
  • Electric vehicle scheme and retail offers
  • Family friendly policies
  • Two paid volunteering days per year


As if that isn’t enough, you’ll receive an annual salary increase whilst you’re on programme and you’ll also get an increase when you move into your first job.


LET’S GO


Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.


Please note, we don’t require a CV or cover letter to complete your application, the system will ask you for this, but you can just upload a blank document.


  • Roles close on Friday 29th March 2024
  • Check your diary – face to face assessments will run from 7th May – 27th June


To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSevernTrent on social media.


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION


At Severn Trent we are passionate about our people. We want to make sure that we continue to foster a more diverse, inclusive, and cohesive culture that represents the communities and customers we serve. We’re making sure we keep up the progress with our wonderful working groups – LGBTQ+, Women in Operations & STEM, Disability and Ethnicity, who help us with our commitments. Find out more about our commitments to Diversity and Inclusion at Severn Trent. Click here to find out more

  • Ability to analyse and interpret information and effectively communicate this to different team members and audiences
  • Curiosity to learn quickly in a reactive and dynamic working environment


HOW WE’LL REWARD AND CARE FOR YOU IN RETURN


It’s not just a job you’ll get here, you’ll get a career too. We have a range of benefits that reward and recognise great work and award-winning training to ensure you reach your potential. And we’ll also help you play your part in looking after the environment and the community in which we live.

With that in mind, here are just some of our favourite perks that you’ll get being part of the Seven Trent family:


  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays (and the ability to buy/ sell up to 5 days per year)
  • Annual bonus scheme (of up to £1,500, which is subject to eligibility)
  • Leading pension scheme – we will double your contribution (up to 15% when you contribute 7.5%)
  • Sharesave – the chance to buy Severn Trent Plc shares at a discounted rate
  • Dedicated training and development with our Academy
  • Electric vehicle scheme and retail offers
  • Family friendly policies
  • Two paid volunteering days per year


As if that isn’t enough, you’ll receive an annual salary increase whilst you’re on programme and you’ll also get an increase when you move into your first job.


LET’S GO


Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.


Please note, we don’t require a CV or cover letter to complete your application, the system will ask you for this, but you can just upload a blank document.


  • Roles close on Friday 29th March 2024
  • Check your diary – face to face assessments will run from 7th May – 27th June


To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSevernTrent on social media.


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION


At Severn Trent we are passionate about our people. We want to make sure that we continue to foster a more diverse, inclusive, and cohesive culture that represents the communities and customers we serve. We’re making sure we keep up the progress with our wonderful working groups – LGBTQ+, Women in Operations & STEM, Disability and Ethnicity, who help us with our commitments. Find out more about our commitments to Diversity and Inclusion at Severn Trent. Click here to find out more

title: Data Analyst
description:
DATA ANALYST APPRENTICE


LET’S CUT STRAIGHT TO IT


Taking care of ‘one of life’s essentials’ – it’s our purpose and we want you to be part of it. Supplying wholesome drinking water, treating wastewater, and recycling this back to the environment responsibly is no mean feat. We serve around 8 million people across the Midlands and Wales and unlike other businesses, our delivery is non-negotiable. It’s a matter of life.

Many of our employees are also our customers, so we truly take pride in what we do! Employing people from across our communities and beyond, Severn Trent is an exciting and inclusive place to work – a place where you can be curious, can be ‘Wonderfully You’ and where you can truly make an impact to our environment, now and for future generations.


LET’S TELL YOU MORE


Apprenticeship Programmes are a great way to earn and learn! Our Apprentice Data Analyst Programme offers the perfect blend of personal and professional development, exposing you to the core of our business. Entering an Apprenticeship scheme with us involves working towards the role of a fully-fledged professional, earning a salary, whilst also being able to maintain a sense of academic achievement. At Severn Trent we provide the perfect mix between hands-on experience and a formal qualification, enabling our apprentices to make a real lasting difference to our customers and communities, not just for now, but far into the future.


You’ll be supported every step of the way, by your line manager and mentor. Responsibilities of businesses are changing rapidly; society increasingly expects that organisations should act responsibly not just to their shareholders but also to their wider stakeholders and the broader community. Working alongside either our Capital Delivery team or Workforce Planning & Optimisation Team, you’ll become a key component of virtually all types of business models where profit and growth are a means to an even greater end, such as protecting the environment and improving societal sustainability. You’ll help to innovate and drive ambitions for change and make these a reality that are embedded and implemented across Severn Trent.


HOW WILL THE PROGRAMME WORK


Standard


Data Analyst


Website

https://www.instituteforapprenticeships.org/apprenticeship-standards/data-analyst-v1-1


Apprenticeship Duration


24 months


Apprenticeship Level


Level 4


Locations


Severn Trent Centre, Coventry, West Midlands CV1 2LZ

Finham, Coventry, West Midlands CV3 6SD

Raynesway, Derby, Derbyshire DE21 7BE


Salary

£17,194


Provider/ F2F or Online

TDM / Online


ENTRY CRITERIA


Based on the level of this Apprenticeship Programme (Level 4 Foundation Degree) we require all candidates to have Level 3 qualifications (A-Levels, BTEC National, NVQ/SVQ Level 3, Level 3 advanced apprenticeship)


ROLE EXPECTATIONS POST APPRENTICESHIP


By the end of this programme, you will take up a Data Analyst role, where you will be able to put your skills to action


WHAT WILL YOU LEARN


  • How to access and analyse data from across the entire business. Using it to update existing dashboards and reports, as well as creating your own to meet any new requirements.
  • How to effectively clean, transform, join and validate data from multiple sources (including solving any problems that arise as part of that). Ensuring your data, visualisations, reports, and any conclusions you draw from them are accurate.
  • How to carry out analysis on key measures such as how effectively a team or project is performing right through to higher level company performance metrics that are reported the water regulatory body OFWAT
  • To build internal relationships that foster buy-in to existing and future initiatives.
  • To understand how to act ethically and how this thought process can be brought into everyday business practices.
  • How to analyse and identify Severn Trent’s opportunities and threats. Escalating any risks within your own team or processes if you find them


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


We want our employees to care and to have a genuine passion for what we do as a business. We need people who want to make a difference in providing a vital service to our customers, now and for the long-term.

We’d love you to be someone with…


  • A ‘can do’ attitude – willing to get stuck in, take accountability for decisions and actions and who takes pride in their work
  • A love of variety in a role and ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced working environment
  • Ability to quickly prioritise tasks and the initiative to dive head-first into problem solving.
  • No two days are the same on the front line and not every day goes to plan, so you’ll need to be quick on your feet to respond!
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working with multiple teams
  • Ability to analyse and interpret information and effectively communicate this to different team members and audiences
  • Curiosity to learn quickly in a reactive and dynamic working environment


HOW WE’LL REWARD AND CARE FOR YOU IN RETURN


It’s not just a job you’ll get here, you’ll get a career too. We have a range of benefits that reward and recognise great work and award-winning training to ensure you reach your potential. And we’ll also help you play your part in looking after the environment and the community in which we live.

With that in mind, here are just some of our favourite perks that you’ll get being part of the Seven Trent family:


  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays (and the ability to buy/ sell up to 5 days per year)
  • Annual bonus scheme (of up to £1,500, which is subject to eligibility)
  • Leading pension scheme – we will double your contribution (up to 15% when you contribute 7.5%)
  • Sharesave – the chance to buy Severn Trent Plc shares at a discounted rate
  • 10% monthly discount with Busy Bees Nurseries, and one-week free childcare
  • Dedicated training and development with our Academy
  • Electric vehicle scheme and retail offers
  • Family friendly policies
  • Two paid volunteering days per year


As if that isn’t enough, you’ll receive an annual salary increase whilst you’re on programme and you’ll also get an increase when you move into your first job.


LET’S GO


Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.


Please note, we don’t require a CV or cover letter to complete your application, the system will ask you for this, but you can just upload a blank document.


  • Roles close on Friday 29th March 2024
  • Check your diary – face to face assessments will run from 7th May – 27th June


To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSevernTrent on social media.


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION


At Severn Trent we are passionate about our people. We want to make sure that we continue to foster a more diverse, inclusive, and cohesive culture that represents the communities and customers we serve. We’re making sure we keep up the progress with our wonderful working groups – LGBTQ+, Women in Operations & STEM, Disability and Ethnicity, who help us with our commitments. Find out more about our commitments to Diversity and Inclusion at Severn Trent. Click here to find out more
