title: Data Analyst
description:
Uptime Management Analyst - EU

Competitive salary

40 hours per week

Hybrid (Dunton, Essex and remotely)


Are you looking to grow your career with MSXI?


MSX International has the job for you!


MSX International is looking for a Project Data Analyst to join our busy team at Ford Automotive in Dunton, Essex. As a Project Data Analyst you will be part of our European Uptime Management team, dedicated to improving the customers experience by reducing time vehicles are off the road for maintenance and repairs for our global automotive partner.


The Role

In this role, the Project Data Analyst will consistently deliver process, tools and data for the Big 5 markets. They will be involved in extracting data from internal systems to understand and identify trends, delivering findings and hosting Stand Up Meetings with the senior European Leadership team. Main duties would include:


  • Host and facilitate Daily Big 5 Market governance stand up meeting reporting on escalated vehicle-off-road cases. Cases will include parts supply issues, Technical case resolution and Customer relationship concerns.
  • Provide project management and reporting of the actions from leadership stand up meetings.
  • Work within the team to escalate parts supply chain issues and identify solutions to increase uptime.
  • Identify opportunities to improve reporting and processes.
  • Identify automation opportunities to reduce manual burdens.


About you

This is an excellent opportunity for an individual with advanced Excel and PowerPoint presentation skills, along with strong communication skills. Our ideal Project data analyst will have experience in the automotive industry (not essential) and a confident demeanor presenting results and influencing senior stakeholder in other countries, as well as:


  • Ability and confidence to present results and findings to senior stakeholder management and remain calm under pressure.
  • Ability to influence senior stakeholders in Big 5 European markets.
  • Ability to create advanced reports in Excel, understand the data and create actions based on the results.
  • Ability to create PowerPoint presentations.
  • Ability to learn other bespoke systems.
  • Be a quick learner and have the ability to self-manage priorities and workload


What’s in it for you?

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.


In joining MSX, you can enjoy:

  • 25 days annual leave
  • Company contributory pension plan
  • Cashback healthcare scheme
  • Life Assurance
  • Exclusive discounts on everyday purchases
  • Exclusive discounts on Car purchases
  • Potential to progress within the company, with global opportunities updated regularly


Working pattern and location

  • 40 hours per week
  • Monday – Friday
  • Hybrid Working with office based in Dunton Essex
  • May require some travel to European Markets


About MSX:

With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:

  • Consumer Engagement
  • Parts, Accessories & Service Performance
  • Actionable Insights
  • Diagnostics & Repair Enhancement
  • Warranty and Repair Efficiency
  • Technical Information
  • Learning Solutions
  • Sales Performance


Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.


MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

title: Project Analyst
description:
Calex UK are seeking to recruit a Project Manager/Process Improvement Analyst. This position requires a blend of project management expertise, problem solving skills and data analysis skills. The successful candidate will also have strong interpersonal skills including the ability to influence and direct staff they don't have line responsibility for. They will have a track record in driving projects to a successful conclusion fostering collaboration, and energizing team members.

Responsibilities include:

Project Management:

Lead end-to-end project management, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project scope, goals, and deliverable
Develop and maintain project plans, schedules, and risk management strategies
Monitor project progress and communicate updates to stakeholders

Problem Solving:
Identify and address challenges, leveraging critical thinking and problem-solving skills in order to develop effective action plans
Implement continuous improvement initiatives based on analysis findings

Data Analysis:
Use data to support decision-making
Utilize statistical methods and data visualization tools to communicate findings effectively
Develop and maintain dashboards, and reports to enhance project insights

Team Energizer:
Motivate and inspire project teams without direct line management responsibility
Foster a positive and collaborative team culture, encouraging innovation and creativity
Effectively communicate project goals, priorities, and achievements to boost team morale
Lead by example, demonstrating enthusiasm, resilience, and a solutions-oriented mindset

Skills & Experience Required
Academic or professional qualification in project management including familiarity with Agile and Scrum
Proven experience in project management with a successful track record of project delivery
Strong data analysis skills with proficiency in tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Good problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with diverse teams
Familiarity with business improvement tools such as Lean and Six Sigma

Salary & Benefits

Circa £60,000 dependant on experience, 26 Days Annual Leave, Calex Employee Benefits Package (Inc Private GP and Healthcare Services, High Street Discounts, Discounted Gym Memberships and on Demand 24 Hour Wellbeing Service (Counselling and Advice).

Pre-employment Checks

Calex will undertake the relevant/standard employment checks with any successful candidate. This includes DBS Check, contacting all nominated references, as well as checking candidate ID, driving licence (if appropriate) and right to work in the UK. Some roles may also be subject to further pre-employment checks (confirmation will be provided through the recruitment process).

Your Employment

The successful candidate will be employed by Calex UK, a specialist Automotive Contractor and Training Provider. For more information, please visit www.calexuk.com

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 12 months

Salary: Up to £60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Employee discount
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • Life insurance
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to Commute:

  • Coventry, West Midlands (required)

Work Location: In person

title: IT Analyst
description:
A globally renowned manufacturing group supplying the high technology sectors has a new vacancy for an IT Business Systems Analyst to join the team. You will be responsible for overseeing systems development including ERP Systems to meet the demands of the business. Candidates are sought with a strong understanding of software development lifecycle and excellent SQL query writing skills.



Commutable from: Leicester, Coventry, Hinckley, Nuneaton, Rugby, Loughborough, Coalville

Salary: £ 45,000 - £ 55,000 p.a. + benefits

Suitable for: IT Systems Manager, IT Systems, IT Business Systems Analyst



The Role

The IT Business Systems Analyst will develop end to end solutions to meet business objectives using appropriate programming and reporting tools.

Key responsibilities:
Ensure highest levels of quality assurance for all bespoke development of IT Systems.
Document all development work, producing both technical and end user documentations.
Act as 3rd line support, diagnosing and debugging errors.
Perform ad-hoc data analysis, using appropriate tools to support management decisions.
Assist in developing BI Suite and data warehouse environment.
Support with performance tuning and maintenance of database environment.
Deputise department when needed.



The Candidate

You will be degree qualified, ideally in a computing related discipline and have SQL database development experience. The successful candidate will also have demonstratable knowledge of modern Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau or Microsoft BI and have proven experience of providing accessible, digestible management information that has given a bottom line impact within a business.

With strong IT Skills you will have used MS SQL Server development, SSRS/Crystal XI, Excel, SSIS ETL Data Warehouse Crearion and Visa Studio.NET (some C# and VB would be useful).

For more information send a CV to Alex Price

title: General Ledger Accountant
description:
General Ledger Analyst Ref code: AZR99097209 Finance Transactional £ 13 Onsite Parking Nottingham, Nottinghamshire, England Temporary / Interim Hybrid Working GENERAL LEDGER ANALYST £13-£15 P/H COLWICK, NG4 (HYBRID) FULL TIME, TEMPORARY SF Recruitment are currently recruiting for a General Ledger Analyst to join a thriving and established business on the outskirts of Nottingham. This is a vital role to their business and will be involved in the day to day accounts receivable function and supporting the wider business to ensure that transactions are allocated accurately. Key Duties & Responsibilities: Work as a point of contact for the business for Transactional processing within Customer receivable cash allocation. Serve as interface with internal and external parties for escalation and problem resolution pertaining to Bank transaction, to ensure timely and accurate Cash Allocation Support Finance leadership in problem solving and fact finding analysis Provide local and regional support to end-users on finance policies and procedures Perform Finance Transaction activities, including but not limited to Bank Reconciliation, Payment Transaction, or Cash Allocation Support financial close activities, as needed Partner with key stakeholders by translating feedback into process improvement recommendations Serve as change agent as new technologies and processes are introduced Conduct user acceptance testing for system upgrades and changes Providing ad-hoc reporting for leadership, effectively communicating with our business partners and participating in special or cross-functional projects. Assist with providing requested information for internal and external auditors Individual may perform other duties as assigned, including work in other functional areas to cover absences or relief, to equalize peak work period’s, or otherwise to balance the workload The Ideal Candidate: Keen to learn administration activities Proficient analytical skills and data analysis ability with the background and a deep knowledge of business systems applications. Accuracy and detail oriented Good customer service skills This role is being recruited for on an on-going temporary basis, the company will offer a competitive hourly rate and flexibility of 3 days working from home.


Alex Rowland

Email Alex

title: Business Analyst
description:
Summary

Job Reference:
224348BR

Nottingham Support Office

Permanent

37.5 hours per week

Our application process

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Business Analyst, as a member of the Retail and Supply IT Development team within Boots IT. Reporting to a Lead Business Analyst, you will be responsible for working with members of the Retail and Supply Chain functions to jointly define with them the high-level scope, objectives and requirements for some major upcoming projects in those areas.

Who we are

Boots IT & Advanced Analytics

IT is at the centre of what we do.

This is retail IT for the real world, you’re so close to your customers in all ways – in store, online and internally.

You can get involved with all the different areas of our business, working on projects that make a real difference – from our hugely important in-store systems to our world-class forecasting, replenishment, warehousing and order management systems.
We place so much value on our IT team – if you want to build a career that will keep developing with your skills, there’s no better place to do it.

Boots UK is the UK’s leading pharmacy-led health and beauty retailer. With around 2000 stores in the UK and Ireland, our purpose is to help our customers look and feel better than they ever thought possible. You can learn more by visiting boots.jobs

Diversity, equity and inclusion is at the centre of everything we do in our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, passionate about embracing the diversity of our colleagues and providing a positive and inclusive working environment for all.

About the role
As a BA within Boots IT and Advanced Analytics, you will have these specific responsibilities:

  • Building enduring relationships with the business areas, favouring strong collaborative interactions over processes and documentation
  • Facilitating the analysis and user story creation for projects and programmes
  • Ensuring that user stories are sized to an appropriate level of detail, with all acceptance tests agreed
  • For larger projects and programmes, staying involved with the project right through to delivery and implementation, Ensuring that the user acceptance phase fully tests that the solution meets the requirements
  • Bringing a BA approach/methodology to wider departmental initiatives and ad hoc investigations

What you’ll need to have
The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate:
  • A natural curiosity that drives them to really want to understand the business process to which the solution is to be applied
  • An ability to get to the real nub of the issue, beyond how the problem is first described
  • That they are comfortable to challenge the perceived wisdom and request evidence (facts and data) to support what they are being told
  • A track record of bringing clarity of thought to complex and potentially initially vague situations
  • Good relationship-building skills
  • Evidence of over five years of experience of using industry best practise BA tools and techniques
  • A good all-round appreciation of how IT is leveraged in successful UK Retail companies

It would be great if you also have
  • Experience in leading the pre delivery requirements stage of a project that is subsequently delivered by a third party software house

Hybrid Working – 3 days in office, 2 days from home

We currently operate a fixed hybrid working approach for Support Office team members with a mix of remote and office-based working. Our set office days are Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday with team members able to work remotely if they wish on Mondays and Fridays.

Our benefits
  • Boots Retirement Savings Plan
  • Generous employee discount plus enhanced discounts for Boots brands, Boots Opticians and Boots Hearingcare
  • Excellent onsite facilities including staff shop, opticians (including free eye tests for team members), gym, cafeteria and outdoor seating

We have a great range of benefits in addition to the above that go beyond salary and offer flexibility to suit you;(all rewards and benefits are subject to change and eligibility).

In joining Boots IT & Advanced Analytics (IT2A) you will be able to access: The WBA IT Academy, BCS up to the level of fellow, the ISF for professional development in the Cyber Security and Information Governance arena, HIMSS for certification in the use of digital healthcare, CHIME for globally recognised qualification in the delivery of digital healthcare. Additionally, a series of internal capabilities are also available to all members of the team including regular connections to the full team, delivering change through technology at Boots. The team ethos is one of shared learning and the team will support attendance at public learning throughout the UK and the onward sharing of this within the team.

Boots IT2A has a well-established diversity, equity and inclusion model and charter known as Inclusive IT that strives to make allies of everyone who works within the team. This job role is one which could be performed on a part-time or full-time basis.



What’s next?

If your application is successful, our recruitment team will be in touch to arrange an interview and to answer any initial questions you have. If you have not been successful on this occasion, you will be notified by email.

We are always open to discussing possible flexible working options and what this may look like for you, including job share and reduced hours. If you require additional support as part of the application and interview process, we are happy to provide reasonable adjustments to enable you to be at your best.

title: Senior Analyst
description:
Summary:

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Senior Energy Analyst to join our client, a B2B Energy Services Company. As a member of the Client Services team, you will be providing support to corporate energy consumers accounts (Fixed and Flex) in the UK and Ireland, ensuring a high-quality service. The successful applicant will have B2B energy industry experience in a similar role, will be commercially and analytically minded and proficient in Microsoft Excel. If you are a confident communicator with excellent attention to detail, apply today!

Key responsibilities:

  • Assisting with client queries in line with service level agreements
  • Develop and maintain excellent working relationships with suppliers
  • Contract set-up and process management
  • Multisite queries / COTs / data collection / data analysis
  • Ensure relevant CRM platforms are kept updated
  • Assisting with other ad-hoc work that is required by the wider team

Skills and experience required:

  • Experience in the energy industry is essential
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel
  • Experience in a similar role is desirable
  • Sales Force experience highly desirable
  • Excellent team working skills with the ability to communicate at different levels
  • Strong organisational skills with the ability to use your own initiative
  • Able to work within a dynamic environment with good attention to detail

title: Apprentice Data Centre Engineer Data Infrastructure
Apprentice Data Centre Engineer Data Infrastructure
Data Analyst
description:
Lear For You


We work hard for the people who work for us. We champion our teams. We foster collaboration, inclusion, respect and excellence. What we are trying to say is we want to be more for you.


We are your path to a better career, a better future, and a better you.


Our teams have invented groundbreaking technologies, flawlessly manufactured millions of products and earned a long list of awards. Year after year, we are one of the World's Most Admired Companies.


Our teams are the secret to our success. They are empowered, inventive and inclusive. Passionate about their craft. Driven to succeed. Because we all understand that we must work together to win.


Are you ready for a better career? A better future?


We're Lear For You.


Lear, a global automotive technology leader in Seating and E-Systems, enables superior in-vehicle experiences for consumers around the world. Our diverse team of talented employees in 39 countries is driven by a commitment to innovation, operational excellence, and sustainability. Lear is Making every drive better™ by providing the technology for safer, smarter, and more comfortable journeys. Lear, headquartered in Southfield, Michigan, serves every major automaker in the world and ranks #179 on the Fortune 500. Further information about Lear is available at lear.com or follow us on Twitter @LearCorporation.


Lear’s Industry 4.0 Strategy

As a global technology leader of automotive Seating and Electrical components operating across over 250 facilities within 37 countries around the world, Lear Corporation is at the forefront of various aspects of technological evolution. Industry 4.0 within Lear Corporation is underpinned through the integration of intelligent digital technologies and analytical systems into manufacturing and industrial processes. Lear Corporation’s industry 4.0 strategy is primarily divided into 2 key operating functions. Firstly, the successful project management and execution of industry 4.0 initiatives into our manufacturing operations. Secondly, the digital analysis and data gleaned from visual management systems ensuring Lear takes informed decisions across its wider business maximizing our operational efficiency whilst upholding the highest quality standards ensuring that Lear’s operational and financial objectives can be achieved.


As a data scientist you will be engaged with various departments to understand their data and preform analysis of the raw data to turn it in to meaningful information to support strategic decisions. Supporting industry 4.0 projects and the rollout of inactivates that are identified.


Main responsibilities:


  • As a member of the EU&AF AME team, manage data-focused projects using Lear’s analytics platform within EU&AF AME team.
  • Contribute to projects from inception, addressing initial problem statements.
  • Develop standard data analysis toolset for senior management.
  • Utilize data mining methods and tools.
  • Generate large databases from structured and unstructured data sources.
  • Analyze customer forecast data for trends and patterns.
  • Employ programming languages to transform big data into manageable datasets.
  • Translate technical data into actionable insights for stakeholders.
  • Create interactive dashboards with real-time data visuals.
  • Provide expert analysis throughout program lifecycle.
  • Integrate diverse data feeds into scalable datasets using various technologies.
  • Publish global performance KPI charts.
  • Maintain and enhance documentation and procedures according to internal and Sarbanes Oxley standards.
  • Optimize system performance for hardware and technology resources.
  • Work independently with strong interpersonal skills to foster relationships across departments.

Key Skills and Qualifications:


Required:

  • 3- 5 years’ work experience in IT system environment.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, IT, Computer Science or comparable technical study
  • Business Analysis expirience
  • Proven experience in management of the full lifecycle of projects in data science and machine learning.
  • Strong analytical skills with accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Intermediate to expert level of knowledge of Microsoft SQL platform.
  • Intermediate level of software development skills

Preferred:

  • Experience within automotive industry or comparable high volume production industry
  • Experience of working within a multinational organization with international, cross functional teams.
  • Exposure to data management within manufacturing operations.
  • Experience in coding or software / systems development

title: Business Analyst
description:
What you'll be doing?

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our newly formed Group Data Office (GDO). As a vital member of the new team, you will play a pivotal role in leading the growth and maturity of our Business Engagement from scratch; bridging the gap between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring delivery of data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate should be proficient in business engagement, delivery management of small work packages, collaborative design with power BI developers, with a proven track record in similar environments.

Reporting into the Business Engagement Manager, this role is intended to work in the Business Engagement Team within the Group Data Office (GDO). The Business Engagement Team will own our delivery roadmap, work with the business to triage and prioritise work requests, better understand those work requests then define formal requirements with the business, drive review, UAT and launch in collaboration with Business Change and Adoption.

You will be expected to:

  • Engage with business stakeholders to understand their commercial outcomes, how they link to organisational goals, and how insight would help them achieve those outcomes
  • Translate actionable insight into documented, prioritised requirements
  • Collaborate with Visualisation to develop wireframes and proof of concepts to demonstrate how an insight product, or dashboard, could meet their requirements
  • Collate feedback from the users of insight products; using this in collaboration with the Visualisation Team to improve the products
  • Manage the delivery of small work packages, ensuring stakeholders are kept up to date on progress vs plan (larger work packages would involve support a project manager)
  • Work closely with project managers and Change & Adoption on larger projects supporting requirements gathering, UAT and launch
  • Understand the end to end analytics process from data collection, feasibility study to business logic and reporting
  • Act as a liaison between business and technical teams ensuring clear communication and alignment

What you'll need?

To be successful in the role, we are looking for:
  • Proven track record as a business or data analyst within an analytics or data-driven environment
  • Strong understanding of data analysis principles and methods with the ability to extract meaningful insights from data
  • Experience in managing the delivery of small work packages, from requirement gathering to solution implementation
  • Proficiency in collaborating with Power BI developers to design and deploy impactful visualisation products
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage credibly with both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Detail-orientated mindset with strong problem solving abilities, capable of root cause analysis and proposing innovative solutions
  • Familiarity with project management practices and the ability to work alongside project managers for larger initiatives
  • Self-motivated and adaptable, especially to an evolving environment

Our Company and Benefits

We’ve been nationally recognised as a 5 star housebuilder since 2009 for supplying high-quality homes for all generations. That’s more than any other major housebuilder. It’s because we combine the brightest minds, the latest technology, and a genuine commitment to putting customers first. We want the best people in the industry to help us shape the future of building. We have tailored opportunities for apprentices, graduates, experienced professionals and ex-Armed Forces personnel to come and help us stay one step ahead, and build the homes that Britain needs.

We are building an organisation where anyone with drive and talent can pursue the career they want. We are building a culture where anyone, regardless of gender, race, sexuality, disability, background or any other characteristic, can progress and be proud to work for us.
Barratt adopts a hybrid way of working which assumes that where roles allow, our office-based colleagues divide their time between working in the office, on our construction sites and sales offices, and working from home, as the role dictates. We recognise the many benefits that an effective hybrid working culture brings to both the Company and our colleagues.

As part of working for Barratt Developments PLC and specifically for this role we offer:
  • Competitive Salary
  • Competitive Bonus Scheme
  • Private Medical Insurance - Single Cover
  • Annual Medical Health Assessment
  • 26 days’ holiday (increase by 1 day for every 3 years’ continuous service up to 29 days)
  • Choice of Flexible Benefits
  • Enhanced Family Friendly Policies

title: Customer Insights Analyst
description:
We’re building thriving communities as one of the UK’s largest housing groups and a leading developer of affordable housing.

We believe everyone is entitled to a good home they can afford, in a place they are proud to live. More than 100,000 people live in our homes.

If you want to experience work that’s truly rewarding, join us. Because when we achieve together, customers and communities thrive.

Work for Orbit. Believe in people.

The role

In this exciting newly created position of Insight Lead. In this role you will need to use data to identify trends and themes for when/why things go wrong for customers across their customer journey.

Using root cause analysis techniques, you will demonstrate strong stakeholder engagement and influence to facilitate continuous improvement sessions to identify and monitor service improvements to prevent future complaints.

This role is part of Customer & Communities where you'll help us to lead the way keeping our promise to more than 100,000 customers.

What you'll achieve

In this role of Insight Lead you will prepare reports summarising complaint statistics, trends, and outcomes, identifying systemic issues or recurring problems.

Your key responsibilities will be to:

  • Develop a strong understanding of regulatory obligations associated to complaint handling within the social housing sector to be able to identify risks associated through Orbit’s complaint handling and failure in delivery of services resulting in complaints.
  • Conduct reviews of determinations from the Housing Ombudsman with business areas to identify under-performance against areas of our customer journey.
  • Demonstrate a confident ability to organise and facilitate root cause analysis sessions with senior stakeholders from different business areas, showing a good ability to influence decisions leading to improvement of services.
  • Develop and build sustainable relationships with our partners to provide greater transparency on their performance and encourage continuous improvement through the delivery of their contracts.
  • Develop sustainable relationships with engaged customers and ensure that the voice of the customer is represented throughout service reviews and improvement plans.
  • Prepare concise reports and presentations, documents and briefings as required for a wide variety of audiences, being able to demonstrate the benefit impact realisation of improvement activities.
  • Work closely with the central Data team in Orbit, becoming a part of their Virtual Team of PowerBI developers following best practices.

What you'll bring

In this Insight Lead position you will need strong analytical skills are essential for analysing determinations, complaint causes and outcomes, and finding appropriate improvements.

Essential skills

  • Experience of working with and manipulating large data sets into tangible MI and experience of providing insight-based analysis
  • Strong understanding of and ability to interpret regulatory obligations underpinning the sector.
  • Experienced in stakeholder engagement and influencing.
  • Experience of delivering effective working relationships with a varied customer and partner group
  • Strong interpersonal skills, being a great communicator (both written & verbal).

Desirable skills

  • Business writing and reporting skills
  • Previous experience within insight, analytics, or root cause analysis
  • Working knowledge of key MI tools including PowerBI (Desktop and Service) and Excel tools (PowerPivot and PowerQuery)
  • PL-300 Microsoft PowerBI Data Analyst certification

Why Orbit?

Choosing us means being rewarded in every sense.

Here’s what you can expect to enjoy with us.

A rewarding experience that works for you

We strive to create an inclusive experience with benefits and wellbeing programmes designed to help you, and your loved ones, to thrive. For a better work life balance, we offer flexible working opportunities for many roles.

A place to progress

From training programmes to professional qualifications, we provide opportunities to learn and develop at every stage of your career. Whether you’re a student, graduate or experienced professional we’ll support you to grow.

For leaders, our tailored development journeys are designed to stretch and strengthen your leadership skills. As well as practical training, we give you access to renowned business schools and experiential programmes for greater breadth and depth of learning.

A purpose to feel proud of

We’re proud to make a difference to people together. We’re values-driven with a commercial focus on performance - because the more profit we make, the more we can achieve for people.

What brings us together is a passionate belief in progress and people.

Read more about the values and purpose that drive us on our careers website.

How we hire

We aim to make our hiring process simple and fair:

  • Online application
  • Interview(s)
  • Decision and offer

We put the safeguarding of our customers, colleagues and contractors at the heart of everything we do and as such, certain roles will be subject to a DBS check.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Paul Smith is one of Britain’s leading independent design companies. We champion positivity, curiosity and creativity. These qualities underpin every Paul Smith design, whether it’s a shirt, a shop or a special collaboration. Reaffirming the values that Paul set down in 1970, ‘classic with a twist’ remains the guiding principle of the company. Happily positioned between high fashion and formalwear, while taking reference from both, Paul Smith has always been proud to stand apart.

The primary function of this role is to support the business with regards to point of sale (POS), ERP to POS interfaces and offering retail operations IT support.
You will be the principal contact for retail operations, managing and logging support tickets. You will work closely with our POS provider to find solutions in a timely manner and feedback regular updates to the users on their tickets. The role will also involve working as a liaison between users and technical teams to support the development of new system functionality.

The Role
  • Be a central contact for the retail operations and wider business with regards to POS system issues. Logging issues accordingly through the support portal or triaging these to relevant teams.
  • Regularly communicating updates on support tickets and documenting the solutions that are found for future reference.
  • Building knowledge on system configurations to aid logging tickets with our POS provider to supply them with more information.
  • Help provide additional 2nd/3rd line support on projects and assistance with network services for POS support.
  • Work closely with other System Support Analysts to gain a better understanding of the full retail operations workflows, including the prima interface and prima role.
  • Maintain and update SharePoint as a central place for ‘guides’ on training and process documentation.
  • Develop technical knowledge to assist in the development of new functionality, POS/ERP upgrades, testing and rollouts of other services.
  • Act as a point of contact between business system support, network services and retail operations.
  • Maintain UAT (User Acceptance Testing) test plans and help with larger testing such as upgrades.
  • Maintain a technical understanding such as basic configurations, housekeeping in programmes, basic SQL to look at scheduled tasks and table sizes/volume of data.
Your Skills and Experience
  • Computer literate in Microsoft products.
  • Experience using tools like Microsoft Excel to manage and manipulate data for problem solving and analysis.
  • Experience of using ERP/Warehousing software such as Prima, Cegid or similar would be advantageous.
  • Proven experience in a Business Operations Support role such as dealing with user queries, project planning or business analysis would be desirable.
Who you are
  • Have excellent customer service skills with the ability to communicate, written and verbally at all levels.
  • Good attention to detail and trouble shooting skills.
  • Capable to plan, organise and prioritise to achieve deadlines and work under pressure in a busy environment.
  • Own the ability to remain calm under pressure, be self-motivated and work on own initiative.
  • Be reliable, helpful and polite.
What’s in it for you
  • A generous clothing allowance.
  • Discretionary discount on PSL goods.
  • An annual leave entitlement of 25 days, plus Bank Holidays.
  • Flexi-time and hybrid working.
  • Holiday trading.
  • Pension Scheme.
  • Cycle to work and travel loan schemes.

At Paul Smith, we celebrate and encourage applications from all walks of life into our growing workforce. We are committed to empowering people from any background, belief system, or ethnicity, offering an inclusive environment where talent is recognised and valued.

title: Cost Analyst
description:
Costing & Risk Analyst
Here's what you'll be doing

Operating at the heart of E.ON UK's circa £13bn of energy and energy related trading and pricing activities, provide quantitative analysis and commercial support for Energy Markets and the wider business.

Key Responsibilities

  • Produce best in class forecasting of industry costs and their associated risks to E.ON Next and nPower Business Solutions energy supply businesses. These might include TNUoS, DUoS, FiT, RO, CfD or BSUoS, making up half of a customer’s bill. These forecasts will be used to price 7 million customers and will be provided for in E.ON’s internal finances with a total forecasting cost of £15bn over MTP period.
  • Maintain and develop models to produce these forecasts, largely in Excel but increasingly using databases and PowerBI as well.
  • Proactively track and monitor external changes in each of the costs that you own at a detailed level, growing to become the company’s established and respected expert in the costs being managed.
  • Develop key stakeholder relationships both internally and externally, utilising these relationships to ensure costs are well understood and messaged to the business.
  • Provide actual cost reporting and commentary against forecasts throughout the year to directors and other senior stakeholders, increasingly managing relationships with key stakeholders as experience and knowledge grow.
  • Support the development of proposals to mitigate risks associated with the costs that you are forecasting.
  • Work within the wider Energy Markets function to enhance its reputation as an analytical and knowledge centre of excellence, increasingly providing leadership of this task.
  • Further develop your knowledge of the wholesale energy markets, incorporating insights into the costs that you manage.
  • Act as delegate for the senior analysts within the wider team as required.
What we need from you

Essential

  • Insatiable appetite to learn more about electricity and gas network, policy, system and administration costs.
  • Self-starter with ability to work independently increasingly able to scope and drive their own work.
  • Well-developed SQL, PowerBI and Excel skills.
  • Exceptional Analytical Skills with the ability to drive analytical techniques to improve business decisions and provide recommendations on such to management.
  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience, with subsequent experience in a commercial environment.
  • Experience of stakeholder management growing to accomplished stakeholder manager.
  • Experience working with, editing and writing mathematical models.

Desirable

  • Growing knowledge and experience of the energy industry (trading, upstream, retail and solutions).
  • Wide ranging expertise in modelling e.g. regression modelling, scenarios.
  • Experience with Snowflake and Azure.
  • Extensive experience building models in PowerBI.
Here’s what you need to know

We’re committed to equal opportunities and actively promote a diverse and inclusive working environment, and fairness for everyone.

We realise the best people bring their energy at different times, so we’re happy to talk flexible working. We offer a range of flexible working options, including full time, part time, job share and variable start and finishing times

This is a great opportunity to play a lead role in supporting our expanding business and helping to shape the future of energy.
We have a market leading benefits package – it includes a, 26 days’ holiday plus 8 bank holidays, a generous pension scheme and the chance to choose from 20 flexible benefits

E.ON is committed to being an inclusive employer. We recognise that everyone is different and we aim to provide a working environment where each person feels respected, valued and able to achieve their full potential. We are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. If you require any reasonable adjustments, please just let us know.

At a glance

Reference no.:

224195

Closing date:

18/02/2024

Salary:

£41,795 and £56,113
Get in touch

For more information about this role please contact stephen.evans@eon-uk.com

About us
E.ON is a privately owned international energy company. Our 75,000 colleagues in 15 countries work daily towards the improvement of technical innovations and user-friendly customer solutions for the new energy world. We are the first large energy company to focus more heavily upon the energy of the future through our three business areas of energy networks, renewable energies and customer solutions.
Connect with us

title: HMP Nottingham - Business Administrator Specialist - Intelligence Analyst (Ref: 84252)
Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Do you like new challenges? Are you excited about new technology? Are you looking for a new role that stretches your talents? Then this could be the role for you.

Cygnet was established in 1988. Since then we have developed a wide range of health and social care services for young people and adults with mental health needs, acquired brain injuries, eating disorders, autism and learning disabilities within the UK.

A reporting professional with proven track record of supporting an organisation wide reporting strategy, supporting the needs of customers’ within a self-service environment, report requirements gathering and writing, BI Development and strong knowledge of database and reporting technologies.

You will help us gather business requirements and translate them into technical ones, support in the data design and architecture, model complex datasets, create interactive data visualisations and support in transforming Cygnet into a data driven business.

This role is a hybrid role with occassional travel to our offices in Birmingham and London.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Work with multiple stakeholders to understand, interpret and translate constant business requirements
  • To create, develop and maintain business intelligence reports
  • Promote the self-service standard reporting culture
  • Promote the use of BI tools and concepts across the organisation
  • Create Ad hoc data analysis requests using Excel, SSRS and Power BI
  • Creating and managing Power BI workspaces and Apps and maintain existing SSRS reports
  • The point of contact for several business areas and becoming a trusted partner in evaluating and delivering their outcomes into requirements.
  • To communicate and convey complex information in plain English both written and verbal
  • Develop, an understanding of several areas of the business to be able to act as their point of contact and reporting liaison and to add value to the shaping of requirements and handling of report requests.
  • Designing and implementing reporting applications
  • Converting identified existing reporting applications to a standardised infrastructure using standard SQL and MS BI products
  • Support the Business in understanding the data journey by being an advocate for the Analytics tools and solutions
  • Work closely with the Data Engineers to validate data from pipelines
  • Documentation of BI architecture, policies and procedures
  • Ensuring system changes are managed and signed off in accordance with the teams change management process
  • Support junior members of the team
  • Bring new ideas and expertise to support in developing the team
  • Assess new and relevant technologies on the horizon
  • To create opportunities of report automation
  • To create or recommend reporting solutions to support business areas
  • Effective, approachable and sensitive communicator in different communities and cultures
  • Ability to adapt style and approach to meet the needs of different audiences.

General Information:

  • To attend for work reliably and punctually and to follow a work pattern as required fulfilling the role, which may include working overtime if the need arises.
  • To know where to access policies, to keep yourself up to date with all procedures and policy changes and to be aware of and follow their contents.
  • To develop your own and your teams, practice through the supervision and appraisal process, ensuring your continuous professional development needs are identified and addressed.
  • Use an appropriate level of confidentiality where personal information is involved with regard to both individuals in our care and employees.
  • To ensure that people with whom you have contact have equal opportunities, to acknowledge their individual differences and uphold their rights and responsibilities, including the right not to be discriminated against, as set out in law and by policies.
  • To carry out, as and when required, any additional tasks and responsibilities as are reasonably compatible with this job description and its objectives.
  • A duty exists (under Health & Safety legislation) to take reasonable care for the health and safety of yourself and that of others. This implies taking positive steps to understand the hazards in the workplace, to evaluate and take action to reduce the risks. It is expected that you comply with safety rules and procedures and to ensure that nothing you do, or fail to do, puts yourself or others at risk.
  • It is everyone’s responsibility to ensure that everything possible is done to protect individuals in our care from abuse of a physical, sexual, neglectful, financial or institutional nature. This includes an absolute requirement to report any incident of this nature you witness, hear about or suspect.

To apply for this role you will need at least 2 years of real-world business experience using Power BI Desktop and Power BI Service in an enterprise environment.

Why Cygnet? We’ll offer you…

  • An opening to undertake further learning with our excellent apprenticeship scheme
  • Expert supervision & support
  • Employee referral scheme
  • Free Health Cash plan
  • 24 hours free GP support line
  • Free life assurance cover
  • Free eye tests
  • Car lease discounts
  • Discounted gym membership
  • Free mortgage broker and Insurance cover
  • Pension scheme
  • Employee NHS - discount savings & “Cycle to Work” scheme
  • Smart Health Toolkit- Providing you with Fitness Programmes, Nutrition consultation and Health checks

Ready to make a positive change? Please click on the ‘apply now’ link below or send your CV to lenastreet@cygnethealth.co.uk

Due to limits on sponsorship allocations, we are not currently in a position to offer sponsorship to new candidates for these roles, this remains under review.

We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we receive sufficient applications for the role. Therefore, if you are interested, please submit your application as early as possible.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
We are

An award-winning, SaaS transport technology business, head-quartered in the UK. Founded in 2000 as a 4th Party Logistics Provider (4PL), we rapidly expanded its transportation management (TMS) technology and is now one of only a few businesses that has a truly global product capable of supporting any transport operating model.

Your new role

You will support Carrier / Client reviews by managing master data from all functional data owners within the company and supply chain. You will also be recommending and implementing data cleansing processes to ensure that the master data remains accurate going forward. you will work closely with key stakeholders across the organisation, including the central Carrier / Client Team, Transport Managers and Supply Chain. You will be required to deliver performance excellence through robust systems, quality and accurate data, analytics and best practice processes.

What you'll need to succeed

  • Self-motivated and result orientated
  • Able to work in a team and on own initiative
  • Ability to work flexibly and remotely
  • Highly responsive and organised in approach
  • Driven by business and customer needs
  • Drives simplicity
  • Excellent understanding of master data and data mapping principles
  • Microsoft Excel proficiency must be at Intermediate level with regular use of formulas to identify erroneous data, including data and conditional formatting functions.
  • Proficient in MS Office (Word, Access, Outlook, Teams etc.)
  • Experience of process mapping and implication of process changes
  • Data auditing
  • An analytical mindset with problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Able to understand short, medium and long-term priorities
  • An understanding of the Carrier industry would be an advantage

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £25,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

title: Trainee Web Developer - No Experience Required
Cost Analyst
description:
Description

As Senior Cost Analyst you will be the go-to expert on non-commodity costs. You will be responsible for forecasting non-commodity cost items for B2B gas and power supply contracts and maintaining these forecasts within our pricing systems. You will have an in-depth knowledge of industry costs, and an appreciation of ongoing policy changes.

The role will require meeting changing business and industry requirements to continually improve our costing methodology, supporting in the delivery of our commercial objectives. Maintaining the balance between risk management and delivering a competitive cost base is key to success in this role.

Passionate and motivated people are the power behind our growth so we’re looking to expand our team and you could be part of our success story
*
What We Need from Yü*
*
Here’s a taste of what you’ll be doing:*

  • Delivery of non-commodity cost forecasting models and methodology.
  • Maintenance of all cost stack data, ensuring that pricing systems are kept up to date and pricing accurately.
  • Leading on the analysis and forecasting of non-commodity costs, understanding the differences between forecasts and outturn, and making methodology changes as required.
  • Representing Yu Energy at an industry level for non-commodity cost policy changes.
  • Supporting internal teams with any pricing and costing related queries, including providing regular commentary on drivers for cost changes.
  • Liaise with the Trading team to ensure wholesale energy and green certificate costs and risks are accurately reflected in non-commodity forecasts.
  • Support in the development of the analytical capability of the Pricing team.

About Yü
*
If you have what it takes, you could be just what we’re looking for…*

  • 2 years’ proven experience in the energy industry, in a pricing and costing focussed role
  • Excellent numerical and analytical skills; an understanding of statistical modelling would be advantageous.
  • Significant experience of electricity and gas non-commodity costs
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills
  • Self-motivated with an ability to work independently

Yü Come First
*
We have a wide range of benefits for our employees including:*

  • 24 days annual leave + bank holidays
  • Holiday buy – up to 5 additional days
  • Day off on your birthday
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Annual salary review
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Enhanced paternity, maternity and adoption policies
  • Yü made a difference Awards
  • Travel Loan Scheme
  • 3 days additional annual leave if you get married/civil partnership etc.
  • Appointment allowance
  • Long service recognition
  • Refer a friend payment
  • Company sick pay (subject to length of service)
  • New modern facilities
  • Death in service and critical illness cover
  • Plus, many more

About Yü Group
Yü Energy are one of the UK’s fastest growing business gas, electricity and water suppliers, supplying thousands of companies across the UK.
On a mission to shake-up the UK business energy market, our winning combination of expert, personal service and competitive prices are specifically tailored to the needs of commercial customers.

Job Types: Permanent, Full-time

Salary: £40,000.00-£45,000.00 per year

title: Data Analyst
description:
Ref: 07122023VSNFI8_1701946499

Data Analyst - SQL & Power BI - UK-wide

England

  • £25,000 to £32,000 GBP
  • Other Role
  • Skills: SQL, T-SQL, SSRS, Power BI
  • Level: Mid-level

Job description

Data Analyst - SQL & Power BI - UK-wide

07122023VSNFI8_1701946499

A healthcare provider are looking for an Information Analyst with skills in SQL and either SSRS or Power BI to join their established Management Information team, where you'll be responsible for delivering timely and accurate data and reporting solutions for users across the organisation.

This organisation are headquartered in Hertfordshire, although this is a home-based role, so you can be based anywhere in the UK. It's likely you will be asked to travel to their Head Office around twice per year for full IT team meetings, and this will be fully expensed.

We are looking for an individual with strong SQL and T-SQL skills in order to effectively work with the data in their SQL and Snowflake database, as well as experience with either SSRS or Power BI to produce insightful reports and visualisations - currently they're on a journey to migrate most of their SSRS reports over to Power BI, with any new reports being created in Power BI.

This is a really exciting opportunity for an ambitious data professional to progress their career with an organisation who will be committed to your ongoing professional development, with the chance to work towards your Microsoft certifications - you'll have the opportunity to complete your Power BI and Snowflake certifications, and get your ITIL qualifications too.

Requirements:

  • Strong SQL and T-SQL skills - including complex queries, stored procedures, tables, views etc.
  • SSRS or Power BI Report builder experience (including DAX)
  • Excellent communication, problem solving and stakeholder management skills

Benefits:

  • Salary of £25-32,000, depending upon experience
  • 25 days' annual leave plus bank holidays plus day off for your birthday (increasing by 1 day for every 2 years' service up to 28 days)
  • Pension with 5% employer contribution and 3% employee contribution
  • Enhanced maternity package
  • Death in service (2X salary)
  • Learning and development opportunities



Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a DBS and Credit Check.

Nigel Frank are the go-to recruiter for Power BI and Azure Data Platform roles in the UK, offering more opportunities across the country than any other. We're the proud sponsor and supporter of SQLBits, Power Platform World Tour, the London Power BI User Group, Newcastle Power BI User Group and Newcastle Data Platform and Cloud User Group. To find out more and speak confidentially about your job search or hiring needs, please contact me directly at v.simpson@nigelfrank.com

title: Business Analyst
description:
The Bristan Group has partnered with Robert Walters Technology. They are keen to appoint a Business Analyst. You will be help drive business forward by analysing requirements, process and information systems.

As a Business Analyst, you will use data analytics to identify areas for improvement and bridge gaps across products, services and software. This is a critical role for their Transformation Programme and help navigate the changing business needs.

The role is based out of the Tamworth offices, offering a hybrid model, paying a salary range of £50,000 to £55,000 plus bonus and benefits.

The Bristan Group: About Us

The Bristan Group is the leading UK supplier of wash space solutions through Channel partnerships. They have been supplying Brassware, Sanitary ware and Bathroom furniture to the UK markets such as luxury homes and hotels, hospitals and schools to an array of centres and accommodations.

With more than 75 years of combined design and engineering expertise, they are recognised as true industry leaders. They have awarded winning solutions, with exceptional customer service at the very core of their service.

The Role: Business Analyst

As an experienced Business Analyst, you will report directly into the Transformation Director with skills in the following areas:

Duties: Business Analyst

  • Understand business requirements from multiple stakeholders and prioritise them.
  • Perform requirements analysis using various techniques, such as SWOT analysis, MOST analysis, mind mapping, PESTLE analysis, and brainstorming.
  • Interpret business requirements and simplify them for top management analysis and strategic decision-making.
  • Develop solutions based on identified requirements and create change management proposals.
  • Collaborate closely with relevant teams to ensure understanding of requirements and successful implementation.
  • Analyse and report data trends from multiple sources within the organisation to support informed decision-making.
  • Communicate effectively with stakeholders and transfer knowledge to project development teams.
  • Lead reviews of business processes and develop optimisation strategies.
  • Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
  • Design and manage user acceptance testing.
  • Support project management, develop project plans, and monitor performance.
  • Update and implement processes and procedures, and provide necessary training to relevant teams.
  • Collaborate with teams to build business cases.

Experience: Business Analyst

  • Expertise in understanding and eliciting requirements.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to analyse and interpret complex data.
  • Change management experience.
  • Knowledge of business processes and software development.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with diverse teams.
  • Strong organisational skills and attention to detail.
  • Experience in research and technology.
  • Ability to present findings and insights to cross-functional teams and management.

If you’re an ambitious Business Analyst looking to make your mark for an industry leader, we want to hear from you.

For further information, please apply with an updated CV and contact Ajay Hayre on ajay.hayre@robertwalters.com or 07771507035.

All third-party applications will be forwarded to Robert Walters.

Robert Walters Operations Limited is an employment business and employment agency and welcomes applications from all candidates

title: Business Analyst
description:
Salesforce Business Analyst

Salary: Circa £40k

Locations: Coventry - Hybrid working with two days a week to be office based

  • Do you have a proven track record as a Business Analyst, particularly in enhancing and streamlining business processes using Salesforce?
  • Are you experienced in bridging the gap between technical solutions and business objectives, especially within a Salesforce environment?
  • Have your analytical skills been instrumental in past roles for optimising systems like Salesforce, JIRA, Mavenlink, and Power BI?

If so, we would like to hear from you

With an 85% market share and 20 % organic growth this is a remarkable Software company, with a relentless pursuit of excellence and innovation. They are on a mission to build a customer 360 with a single version of the truth for both their people and customers. They are building this on the Salesforce platform using Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Account Engagement.

They are now looking for a Salesforce Business Systems Analyst to help them with this. This is a key role where you will be optimising their business systems landscape, including Salesforce, JIRA, Mavenlink and Power BI

You will be responsible for analysing, designing, and implementing effective solutions, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and providing expert guidance on best practices for these platforms across the company and their subsidiary.

Responsibilities:

  • Requirements Gathering and Analysis:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements related to Salesforce, JIRA, Mavenlink, and Power BI processes and functionalities.

Conduct in-depth analysis with our community to identify gaps, opportunities, and areas for improvement.

  • Solution Design and Customization:

Design and configure solutions for Salesforce, JIRA, Mavenlink, and Power BI to address business needs, leveraging standard features and customisations.

Develop and implement workflows, validation rules, process builder flows, and custom objects as required.

  • Integration and Data Management:

Ensure seamless integration between Salesforce, JIRA, Mavenlink, and Power BI, and other systems as needed

Manage data migration, cleansing, and validation efforts to maintain data integrity.

  • User Training and Support:

Provide training and support to end-users for Salesforce, JIRA, Mavenlink, and Power BI to ensure effective adoption of functionalities.

Act as the primary point of contact for related queries and issues.

  • Power BI Reporting and Dashboard Development:

Create and maintain Salesforce dashboard and reports along with Power BI reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide actionable insights

Work closely with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and deliver insightful visualisations.

  • Documentation and Reporting:

Create comprehensive documentation, including process flows, system configurations, and user guides for Salesforce, JIRA, Mavenlink, and Power BI

Generate reports within the respective platforms to support decision-making.

Requirements:

  • At least 2 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, with knowledge and experience of Salesforce.
  • Salesforce Administrator certification (ADM 201) is desirable; additional certifications (e.g., Advanced Administrator, Platform App Builder) are a plus.
  • Proficiency in Salesforce configurations, customizations, and data management.
  • Experience with JIRA, Mavenlink, and Power BI is a plus, including configuration and reporting capabilities.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

Join this team and enjoy a dynamic and enriching work environment, underscored by a commitment to empowerment, creativity, and community. You can benefit from flexible working schedules, professional development opportunities, and generous bonuses. The inclusive and individuality-celebrating workplace ensures a balance between professional growth and personal well-being.

As they are part of a leading global software conglomerate, you will have access to extensive learning resources and a vast talent network, contributing significantly to the field of education technology. This is the ideal company for those eager to influence change and pursue a career that matches their dynamic energy. They focus on innovation, positive educational impact, and dedication to diversity and equal opportunities.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to £40,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Analyst
description:
Our client’s Insight & Analysis team are looking for a talented and ambitious Strategic Analyst. This person will support the Insight & Analysis team, with a particular focus on forecasting and future planning. If you are passionate and proactive about driving business decisions through meaningful analysis this is the perfect opportunity to take the next step to develop your career. This role also involves managing a small team of analysts - 2 initially, but growing to 4-5.

Responsibilities

Financial Analysis:

· Conduct in-depth analysis of financial accounts, ensuring accuracy and providing valuable insights into the company's financial performance.

· Evaluate historical financial data and trends to support strategic decision-making processes.

· Collaborate with the finance team to gather and analyze financial information for various projects.

Longer-Term Forecasting:

· Develop and maintain comprehensive long-term forecasting models to support strategic planning initiatives.

· Analyze external factors, industry trends, and market dynamics to project future financial performance.

· Work closely with cross-functional teams to provide strategic recommendations for potential business transactions.

· Stay informed about economic, regulatory, and industry changes that may impact the company's strategic direction.

Data Analysis and Reporting:

· Utilize Excel, SQL, and other analytical tools to extract, transform, and analyze large datasets.

· Generate reports and dashboards to communicate key insights and findings to stakeholders.

· Proactively seek opportunities to enhance data analysis processes and reporting methodologies.

· Stay current on industry best practices and emerging technologies to improve analytical capabilities.

Qualifications:

· Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics, or a related field. Master's degree or relevant certifications (e.g., CFA) is a plus.

· Proven experience in a similar strategic analyst role, with a focus on financial analysis and forecasting.

· Strong proficiency in Excel, SQL, and other analytical tools.

· Previous experience in mergers and acquisitions is highly desirable.

· Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.

· Inquisitive mindset, keen to learn, and passionate about data and its strategic implications.

· Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.

· Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

This is a hybrid role so this person will be working at the Burton on Trent offices on average 1-2 days per week. To £55,000 + benefits, great career potential. Interested? Send your CV now!

title: Systems Analyst
description:
Have you ever walked into a place and felt right at home? There’s an undeniable energy about the place. People are chatting, laughing and exchanging ideas. No one’s afraid to speak up. And everyone cares – about the work, customers, each other and even whose karaoke game is strong this week.

This is Phocas in a soundbite.

Our Customer Operations team turn every interaction between a customer and Phocas into a positive one.

The Customer Systems Data Analyst will be the team's systems and data guru focusing on coordinating and maximising the benefits of customer reporting systems and operational activities to optimize our efforts and drive measurable results - which will ultimately contribute to Phocas’s revenue growth and customer satisfaction! Now, that's some seriously impactful work!

Up to the mission?

Here’s how you’ll do it:

  • Dive into various customer systems like Hubspot, JIRA, and Phocas to gather data and conduct comprehensive analysis.
  • Utilise statistical and computational methods to extract valuable insights from data, optimising understanding and pinpointing potential opportunities
  • Visualise data creatively using a range of tools to craft easy-to-grasp diagrams and graphs
  • Create and prepare ad-hoc reports for various stakeholders (internal and external)
  • Keep an eye on data quality, overseeing reconciliation and cleansing activities
  • Produce weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reports for different business functions within the Customer Team
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data needs and suggest improvements
  • Work within the Customer Operations Team to set up processes and systems to make working with data more efficient
  • Foster alignment and synergy across various departments (finance, marketing, and customer success) to enhance collaboration
  • Participate in cross-functional projects and initiatives to improve overall business information

What you’ll need to succeed:

This is a hands-on role that requires attention to detail, the ability to embrace and adopt technical systems; project management, time management and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

  • Proven experience of working with JIRA
  • Excellent Microsoft Excel skills
  • Comfortable and experienced working within different systems and databases
  • Adaptable with able to adjust to rapidly changing priorities.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Project management experience
  • Strong commercial awarness
  • Proven experience in Data Analyst or Data Scientist role ideally within a SAAS environment.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights, data-driven with the ability to extract and analyze data using different CRM, database and analytics tools.
  • A continuous improvement and automation mindset to help bring value to customers quickly

A bit about us to see if we’re a match for your enthusiasm

We’re a business planning and analytics company on a mission to make people feel good about data. We’ve been hard at it for 20, helping 2,300 companies turn complex business data into performance boosting results. Despite our global status, we’ve held on to our start-up roots. The result is a workplace that’s fast, exciting and designed for fun.

We know that fun is different for everyone. So, if you want to trial a new initiative, lead a project, save the planet, or spend more time with your favourite people outside work, you’ll have our full support.

As long as you’re doing what brings you joy, the rest falls into place. Think less stress, higher performance, more energy and all-round nicer human. Your friends and family will thank you.

Full job description - Customer Systems Data Analyst PD.pdf


Create your happy place.

We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Phocas is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Business Development Analyst
description:
Job Title: Analytical Method Development Analyst

Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of analytical chemistry and contributing to the development of cutting-edge methods? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Development and Validation Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a key part in designing, optimizing, and validating analytical methods to support our release and stability efforts. As an integral member of our analytical team, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful implementation of robust methods for the analysis of various compounds.

Responsibilities:

Design and develop analytical methods for the characterization and quantification of compounds using state-of-the-art techniques.

Optimize and validate analytical methods to ensure accuracy, precision, and reliability.

Collaborate with research and development teams to understand project requirements and provide analytical support.

Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to analytical methods, instrumentation, and data analysis.

Stay current with industry trends and advancements in analytical techniques to contribute innovative ideas to the team.

Prepare and maintain documentation, including method development reports, validation protocols, and standard operating procedures.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Analytical Chemistry, Chemistry, or a related field.

Proven experience in analytical method development and validation within a laboratory setting.

Strong knowledge of various analytical techniques, including but not limited to HPLC, GC, KF and spectroscopy.

Familiarity with regulatory requirements and industry standards for GMP analytical method validation.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Effective communication and collaboration skills.

Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

A dynamic and collaborative work environment.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Are you a meticulous Finance Analyst with a flair for captivating attention, abundant enthusiasm, and a vibrant personality?

Our client, a leading organisation with a dedication to environmental sustainability, is embarking on a transformation journey and is in search of a Finance Analyst who not only dissects financial intricacies but also exudes passion, ambition, and a drive for positive change.

As a Finance Analyst, you will not just be a number cruncher; you'll be a key player in driving change within the business. Your ability to build solid relationships and instil trust will be paramount in this role. This is an opportunity to be a driving force for meaningful change, and leverage financial insights to shape critical decisions.

In return for your exceptional skills and dedication, our client offers a competitive salary (£35,000 - £45,000 DOE), 25 days of annual leave plus bank holidays, a generous contributory pension scheme, options to buy shares in their parent company, a Health Cash Plan, and a hybrid flexible working environment.

So, what will your role involve? You'll be at the forefront of:

  • Analysing current and past financial data and performance.
  • Evaluating capital and revenue investment projects for financial returns.
  • Developing predictive financial models for organizational decision-making.
  • Identifying process gaps to improve profit margins.
  • Establishing benchmarks for financial processes.
  • Studying industry-specific research to predict trends.
  • Creating written reports for strategic decision-making.
  • Developing forecasting tools to automate financial data analysis.

Our client would love to see the following traits/experiences:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, or statistics.
  • Proven experience as a financial analyst.
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Excel and ideally Power BI, with SQL experience.
  • Excellent reporting, presenting, and communication skills.
  • Understanding of generally accepted accounting principles.
  • Ability to work with large datasets.
  • Analytical and financial modelling skills.

_ ​Perhaps most importantly - An enthusiasm and passion for driving change _

Working hours for this exciting role are 35¼ hours per week, from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm (Monday to Thursday) and 9:00 am – 4:00 pm on Fridays.

As a Finance Analyst for our client, you will not only contribute to their commitment to environmental sustainability but also guide strategic decisions with your insights. Your role may evolve, presenting potential career advancement opportunities.

If you are ready to bring purpose to financial excellence, apply now.
