title: Business Coordinator
description:
Retail is constantly evolving, which is why we have a diverse Global Business Coordination (GBC) department.

It is our job to think about how we can improve our customers lives, evolve the business, and prepare for the future on an international scale.

We use state-of-the-art technology to bring about digital change that delivers real customer value, internal efficiency and new customer experiences.

This is an opportunity for you to have a truly global impact on our business, driving innovative propositions and services to provide our customers with new and exciting ways to shop and improving the overall customer journey.


Our Global Business Coordination department is responsible for anticipating, identifying, and responding to changes within a constantly evolving retail industry. This is a chance for you to have a global impact by delivering impactful strategic recommendations and project management support on a range of topic areas that include; eCommerce, Marketing, Customer services and Digital Services.

You will be a key part of a hugely ambitious customer strategy team, working with other ALDI markets on a global scale, transforming the business and preparing them for the future. The role will involve supporting countries in delivering the global Customer Interaction strategy.


You will work with the Strategy Manager operating within the Customer Interaction Business Strategy team. You will be designing and implementing our strategic planning cycle and other key governance frameworks, tracking and reporting on the realisation of our customer service and marketing solutions, and managing strategic projects, as needs arise.


You will act as a leader within the Customer Interaction Customer Strategy team, supporting with the development and prioritisation new initiatives and customer propositions. You will be responsible for planning and independently leading various strategic projects efficiently and effectively, continually evolving the process by which we prioritise topics and tracking and reporting the returns on strategic investments.


The role is UK based, but part of a global team, therefore some travel on demand should be expected, as per the needs of the project, or upon request of the Strategy Manager. All travel, accommodation and food expenses will be paid for.

If you would like to join our dynamic team and thrive working in a fast-paced environment, apply to join #TeamAldi today!

Your New Role:


Prioritisation & Strategic Project Management

  • Support wider Customer Strategy and business teams with relevant information & data to inform the effective prioritisation of propositions
  • Proactively utilise commercial data to support QBR’s and other business planning cycles
  • Lead cross-functional collaboration (e.g. meetings, workshops) to ensure stakeholder alignment and engagement with prioritisation of propositions
  • Plan, initiate, manage and independently lead various strategic projects efficiently and effectively
  • Critically review, and iteratively develop the Propositions Prioritisation Matrix, to reflect evolving stakeholder and business requirements
  • Craft clear and concise communications that are tailored to audiences, across different levels and countries (e.g. communication materials including slides)

Financial Tracking & Reporting (Business Benefits)


  • Own the regular global financial reporting of business benefits - Ensure accurate & timely reporting from Countries on benefit realisation in line with business deadlines
  • Work with countries in upskilling of business cases, and activities required to realise benefit
  • Own the creation of Senior Stakeholder comms on Business Benefits (DSC,ICIC, IMC etc.) – regular & ad hoc content
  • Develop, align & implement a process for future business 2.5 business benefit realisation following finalisation of the benefit policy

About You:

  • Knowledge and experience of financial reporting
  • Pervious experience working within an in-house Business Strategy Team or Strategy Consultancy
  • Ability to thrive within ambiguity
  • Strong problem solving skills – ability to ask the right questions and probe into the killer business question(s)
  • Intellectual curiosity and commercial awareness
  • Proven track record in managing and influencing a group of diverse stakeholders, across different teams and levels, in a complex organisation
  • Ability to build strong working relationships, anticipate stakeholder needs & manage expectations
  • Ability to understand business structure and strategic priorities and provide bigger picture and forward thinking
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills
  • Strong communication, influencing and storytelling skills
  • High attention to detail & data accuracy
  • Adept at collating, synthesising and analysing information and data of various formats, and from a variety of sources to glean key insights and inform recommendations

What you will get in Return:

  • Salary starting from £52,985 rising to £61,030
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working
  • The opportunity to travel to ALDI South countries as required
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • Flexible working hours
  • Full training provided with ongoing personal development opportunities
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • A variety of Aldi Perks including bike to work scheme, discounted gym passes, accommodation, travel, cinema and family day out tickets
  • Access to a free, 24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)

If you’re ready to join a forward thinking business with a focus on your development as well as the business, apply today!

Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect

title: Data Analyst
description:
Company Description


As a Customer Data Analyst you will own the creation and delivery of accurate and timely CRM reporting to both support the digital channels as well as providing an understanding of the digital performance to the wider business.

Join us at Greene King the country's leading pub company and brewer, where our mission is to pour happiness into lives and become the pride of great British hospitality. We have something special, deeply rooted in our 220-year brewing and pub history, creating the business we are proudly known for today. Still today our 39,000 strong team are the guardians of what’s wholly British, the pub experience.


Additional Information


In reward for your hard work, you will receive...

You will receive a competitive salary, pension contribution as well as:

  • Agile working policy - 50% working within our Burton on Trent office or pubs and 50% working from home
  • 33 days Holiday – With the opportunity to buy an additional 5 days!
  • Discount of 33% for you and 15% for your loved ones on all of our brands – so you enjoy your favourite food and drink at a discount.
  • Discount of 50% for you and 25% for your loved ones at our Greene King Inns and hotels. – so, you can enjoy a weekend away without breaking the bank
  • Discounted Dental & Health Insurance
  • Life Assurance – Up to 4 times your salary!
  • Free employee assistance program – Mental Health, well-being, Financial, and Legal support because you matter!
  • Refer a friend – who do you know who could be interested in a new role? When they are placed, you could receive up to £1,500 for referring them!
  • Retail discounts – Receive up to 30% of at Superdrug, exclusive discounts with three mobile along with many more…
  • The chance to further your career across our well-known brands – As one of the industry's top apprenticeship providers, we can provide training and development at each level of your career.

Job Description


Your role as a Customer Data Analyst

  • Create, build and optimise Power BI dashboards for stakeholders to utilise, helping them drive action into the business
  • Performing deep-dive analysis for specific campaigns and communicate results to the relevant stakeholders with suggestions in improvements
  • Share insight and recommendations with brand/marketing SMEs to influence the next best course of action
  • Identify and create opportunities to grow digital engagement and conversions through monitoring and optimising the customer data landscape
  • Monitor, measure and optimise measurement frameworks to identify campaign, channel and offer performance to support continuous improvement
  • To collaborate with all wider digital and store teams to optimise the true end to end customer journey and experience

What you’ll bring…

  • Passion, proactiveness and an appetite for learning
  • Good understanding of different digital channels
  • Expertise in digital visualisation tools – ideally Power BI
  • Expert knowledge of Excel and other Microsoft Office programs
  • Good knowledge of programming languages such as SQL and DAX
  • Experience in Treasure Data and Braze (or similar platforms) preferred but not required
  • Understanding of how to use data & insight to spot both issues and opportunities to help drive marketing objectives
  • Understanding of various performance marketing techniques and how to use data to optimise campaigns
  • Is commercially aware and able to integrate company agenda into thinking


#LI-AP1

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
About The Role

We are growing our Business Analysis team and have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst to join the Society to support our business transformation and the delivery of our brand-new strategy.

As a Senior Business Analyst at The Nottingham, you will lead BA activity on allocated projects whilst supporting the ongoing development of the function through coaching of team members and driving continuous improvement.

We have a large, progressive change agenda with lots of exciting new projects and opportunities in the pipeline – if you’re excited by change, transformation and a new challenge, this is the perfect role and organisation for you!

Here’s a taste of what you’ll be doing as a Senior Business Analyst at The Nottingham…

  • Support the delivery of the organisation’s change plan, comprising of programmes, projects and small change initiatives – all of which will be supporting our exciting new strategy
  • Conducting early project shaping and scoping activity, feasibility studies and the production of Project Brief documentation
  • The capture of business requirements, with supporting models and documentation, and the management of those requirements through the change lifecycle
  • Collaborate with stakeholders at various levels of seniority and project team members to support the design, development, test, implementation and closedown activity undertaken by change initiatives
  • Contribution to the ongoing development of the business analysis function, driving continuous improvement bringing fresh new thinking to the table
  • Support the development of business analysis team members via coaching, mentoring and peer to peer support

What we’re looking for –

You’ll be able to demonstrate transferable skills and experience within a similar business analysis role – we are looking for an individual who can confidently lead business analysis activity on complex change initiatives with significant knowledge of business analysis processes, tools, techniques, and best practice standards.

Strong communication and collaboration skills are essential for this role and how we work at The Nottingham – we are looking for someone with excellent stakeholder management skills and high levels of engagement and drive!

What we offer -

  • A fair and competitive salary evaluated against market data, annual discretionary bonus scheme, Medicash healthcare scheme, 25 days annual leave, holiday purchase scheme, 2 paid volunteering days per year and enhanced family leave
  • Commitment and dedication to your ongoing personal and professional development. We help you to own and grow your potential so you can be at your best in your current role and to support your future career aspirations
  • Flexible and hybrid working to encourage a work life balance, we want you to be at your best inside and outside of work
  • A friendly and inclusive culture where teams genuinely strive to do the right thing by their colleagues and our customers
  • We're an organisation with a strong sustainability agenda – we’ve made huge steps in the right direction and we’re continually finding new ways to be kinder to the environment by reducing our carbon footprint
  • Your health and wellbeing is important to us; we have a full suite of health and wellbeing resources and support available for all team members

About Us

So, what does #LifeatThe Nottingham look like? We’re a mutual, which means we don’t have shareholders. Instead, we’re owned by our members and use our money to do good, investing in our community, responsible causes, and – well, you. So, we’re always striving to do the right thing for our team, communities and members.

Although our history spans 170 years, our purpose of helping our members save, plan for and protect their financial futures is enduring. This means supporting them through all of life’s key milestones. From providing a safe place for their savings, help and support finding and funding their home, insuring their assets and planning for their families and their future.

title: Research Analyst
description:
• Working for a well known household name
  • Exposure to their cutting edge business arm

About Our Client

A global Grocery company that opened it's doors over 50 years ago. Their aim is to simplify the grocery store experience and offer far lower prices than competitors. With nearly a 1000 stores in the UK alone, they are in the top 5 grocery retailers within the UK.

Job Description

  • Inspire innovation to the Customer experience. You will be responsible for identifying consumer trends, and unmet needs for multiple markets
  • Lead & deliver in-house qualitative & quantitative research studies
  • Brief & project manage research conducted through third parties
  • Design and socialise deliverables to communicate key findings
  • Present research recommendations to Senior Leadership
  • Build and maintain strong & cooperative relationships with National Research Teams
  • Proactively identify opportunities to add additional value through Consumer Research

The Successful Applicant

  • As a Research Analyst you will have experience in planning, designing & executing quantitative research studies
  • The successful candidate will have experience in creating compelling insights to influence senior stakeholders
  • Ability to build strong working relationships, anticipate stakeholder needs & manage expectations
  • High attention to detail & data accuracy
  • Ability to ask the right questions and identify the most effective research methods to solve business problems
  • Strong communication & presentation skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and effectively prioritise conflicting requirements
  • Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach

What's on Offer

  • 5-day/40-hour week, working Monday- Friday, with an office on demand working model (you only come into the office when requested, with a primary office location in Tamworth)
  • 5 week's annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • Flexible working hours
  • Full training provided with ongoing personal development opportunities
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity, paternity and adoption leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • A variety of Perks including bike to work scheme, discounted gym passes, accommodation, travel, cinema and family day out tickets
  • Access to a free, 24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all employees and their children (under the age of 16)

title: Senior Risk Analyst
description:
INFO

SALARY:

£40000 - £45000

LOCATION

Leicester

JOB TYPE

Permanent

Senior Credit Risk Analyst

Leicester

Up to £45,000

Hybrid

The Company

This is Top UK retail company that is looking to bring in a Credit Risk Analyst with a technical background to help increase the company's profitability by driving insights and spotting new trends across the market.

The Role

As a Senior Credit Risk Analyst, you will be:

  • Reporting on credit risk insights and trends to senior stakeholders
  • Using analytics skills to improve credit risk rule-based systems
  • Driving credit risk insights and trends
  • Spotting trends to find new ways to increase profitability across the busines
  • Developing new lending opportunities across the business

Your skills and experience

To be successful as a Senior Credit Risk Analyst, you will need:

  • Strong experience with SAS and SQL
  • Experience working with credit risk reporting
  • Experience working in financial services (ideally a Bank)
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong stakeholder management
  • A numeric degree from a top university

Benefits

Up to £45,000 + benefits package

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Sean Tunley via

CONTACT

Sean Tunley

Recruitment Consultant

title: Supply Chain Analyst
description:
We are seeking a detail oriented, strategic and highly motivated Supply Chain Analyst.

As a Supply Chain Analyst, you will be responsible for Supply Chain processes and procedures across various departments within the business. We are looking for someone with excellent communication and organisational skills and the ability to use their own initiative.

We do things our own way at Aldi. But whatever we're doing, we must be getting it right. With a wave of impressive sales figures behind us, we're opening new stores at lightning speed. And without our Supply Chain team, there'd simply be no products in those stores.


A fixed term role (23 months) in the National Supply Chain Deployment Team is a great opportunity to play a key part in shaping the future department and its ways of working. Possible further permanent opportunities will be available. You will gain valuable experience working on a global transformation project and become a real expert at the end of it. You will form relationships with GB/IE colleagues across the supply chain team and wider business.

You will be instrumental in creating reports and dashboards, User Acceptance Testing and training on the new SAP based systems and helping to shape future reporting and processes by incorporating data visualisation and national reports.

You will also support the Supply Chain Deployment Team and will work with representatives from across all business and IT domains. As such you will require a proactive approach and a high level of multi-tasking and resilience.

The role would suit either a degree qualified data scientist or someone with suitable in industry experience, with knowledge of R Studio, Python and analytics software, confident working with Big Data and analysing trends and making recommendations. A confident individual with great communication skills would be ideally suited to this opportunity.

This is a fantastic opportunity for you to develop within the business and play a key part in shaping the future of Aldi globally. Ready for more? Apply to join #TeamAldi today!

Your New Role

  • Data analysis, data maintenance, data representation/visualisation.
  • Ability to create business reports.
  • Ability to identify gaps in the new processes and define new ones as required.
  • Create PowerPoint presentations to illustrate processes.
  • Data cleansing and readiness of existing systems.
  • Process definition and testing.
  • Creating training materials, functional design documents.
  • Planning and delivery of training to business users.
  • Ensures deadlines are complied with in area of responsibility.
  • Provides updates to Deployment Lead.
  • Reporting of risks, issues and business readiness status.
  • Identification of cross domain risks.
  • Identifies and communicates project information necessary for senior management decision making.
  • Supports creation and maintenance deployment project plans.
  • Supports creation of rollout plans in conjunction with test regions and third parties as required.

About You

  • Strong communication and organisational skills.
  • Ability to proactively work towards challenging deadlines through multitasking and resilience.
  • Flexibility for travel requirements to Europe and throughout GB/IE necessary.
  • Reporting and data analytics experience.
  • Experience in Tableau and SQL report creation.
  • Experience of working within a project.
  • Experience of managing change whilst Business As Usual (BAU) activity is ongoing.
  • Previous experience in SAP Supply Chain solutions.

What You'll get in Return:

  • Starting salary from £46,345 rising to £50,870
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working.
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays.
  • In office flexi-time.
  • Full training provided.
  • Pension scheme.
  • Private employee medical insurance after 4 years.
  • Company sick pay scheme.
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards.
  • Access to a free,24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)
  • Access to MyBenefits, where you can find a wide range of benefits, including our bike to work scheme, shopping and cinema discounts, health cash plan, a FREE will, travel and discounted gym memberships, as well as a host of benefits to support your financial and wellbeing needs.

Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect.

If you're looking for a career that gives you more, apply today!

title: Data Analyst
description:
INFO

SALARY:

£30000 - £42000

LOCATION

Nottingham

JOB TYPE

Permanent

DATA ANALYST

£30,000 - £40,000

NOTTINGHAM (hybrid)

Here's an exciting opportunity to work in an innovative data-driven environment within a global international financial brand!

THE COMPANY

This is a well-known financial brand that puts data first and enjoys innovation through tech, utilising the latest tools to solve problems. This customer-focused brand will enable you to grow your career and develop your skills within a team of experts and data leads!

THE ROLE

This is an 18-month contract as a Data Analyst, in which your focus will be to understand the customers through deep dive analytics. Specifically you will have to:

  • Use SQL to query data and provide insights into customer segmentation, retention and engagement
  • Predict how business decisions may be responded to by the customer, allowing the business to strategically plan releases and product launches
  • Run tests in customer acquisition to allow for better marketing decisions to be made and enable customers to experience a more personalised experience
  • Take part in wider business insights, building reports through Power BI that work to make informed decisions across the group

YOUR SKILLS

The successful candidate will have the following skills and experience:

  • Strong SQL to query and code large data sets, being analytically-minded with a passion for data led decisions
  • Data visualisation experience in PowerBI/Tableau or Looker
  • Experience working across different teams pulling data from a wide range of sources
  • Great communicator and able to convey complicated technical terms in digestible language

THE BENEFITS

  • Base salary up to £40,000 DOE
  • Flexible hybrid working
  • Total benefits package
  • An excellent name on the CV and

title: Data Analyst
description:
INFO

SALARY:

£30000 - £40000

LOCATION

Nottingham

JOB TYPE

Permanent

DATA ANALYST

£30,000 - 40,000

NOTTINGHAM

Opportunity to work within an innovative data driven environment within a global international financial brand!

THE COMPANY

A data 1st financial brand who are innovative with tech and utilise the latest tools to solve problems. This customer focused brand will enable you to grow your career and develop your skills within a team of experts and data leads!

THE ROLE

As a Data Analyst your focus will be to understand the customers through deep dive analytics, specifically you will have to:

  • Use SQL to query data and provide insights into customer segmentation, retention and engagement
  • Predict how business decisions may be responded to by the customer, allowing the business to strategically plan releases and product launches
  • Run tests in customer acquisition to allow for better marketing decisions to be made and enable customers to experience a more personalised experience
  • Take part in wider business insights, building reports through PowerBI that work to make informed decisions across the group

YOUR SKILLS

The successful candidate will have the following skills and experience:

  • Strong SQL to query and code large data sets, being analytically minded and a passion for data led decisions
  • Data visualisation experience in PowerBI/Tableau or Lookr
  • Experience working across different teams pulling data from a wide range of sources
  • Great communicator and able to convey complicated technical terms in digestible language

THE BENEFITS

£30,000 - 40,000 annual salary, flexible working and competitive benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Gerard Matthews via the apply link on this page.

title: Intern
description:
Nottingham Trent House (95002), United Kingdom, Nottingham, Nottinghamshire

Strategy Analyst Internship

Strategy Analyst Internship

Salary: £28,000 per annum plus a £1,000 joining bonus and other benefits

Location: Nottingham Only

Start date: 24th June 2024 for 10 weeks (dates are fixed)

Sponsorship: We’re able to sponsor if you currently have the right to work in the UK including student visas

Eligibility: Open to any penultimate year university students

(This includes undergraduates, masters and PhD students)

Closing date: 19th February (subject to change)

Ten weeks to discover what our business is about.

That's one good thing.

At Capital One, we're on a mission: to change the world of credit for better – one small, good thing at a time. You might think of us as a credit card company. But the truth is, we're just as much a technology business. And we're here to make a positive difference – to our customers, our colleagues and society as a whole.

One of the happy consequences of making finance easier for our customers is that it makes Capital One an inspiring place to launch your career. Join us, and you can gain valuable experience as you take on meaningful work in collaborative teams.

We are committed to creating a level playing field and seek to create teams that are representative of our customers and the communities we serve. We’d love to hear from you if you identify with an under-represented group in our industry and are particularly keen to hear from women, the LGBTQ+ community and ethnic minority candidates.

We want to help you grow. That’s why we invest heavily in your learning and development. We’ve got a great track record of hiring graduates and enabling them to reach their full potential. Just look at our CEO, Lucy Hagues. She started as a graduate and now leads the UK business. And that’s just one of many success stories.


Strategy Analysts at Capital One

You’ll come at problems from fresh new angles. You’ll bring great ideas (and you won't be afraid to share them). You’ll keep our whole organisation on the right track. You'll use insightful data analysis along with critical judgement skills to solve problems and drive change that leads the whole industry forwards.

At Capital One, we’re always looking at ways to boost our business and give our customers a better experience. On this ten-week programme, you’ll take a bird’s eye view of our business, and help us find new ways to improve every aspect of what we do. Expect great training as you take on real projects with support from the team around you. You’ll even get to meet our CEO, Lucy Hagues, who started on our Graduate Programme, and now heads up the UK business.

And it isn’t just about honing your professional skills. There's plenty of scope for personal development too. You'll be assigned a manager, mentor and buddy to support and advise you along the way. You can also get involved in social events run by our dedicated GradComms team or give back to the community through any of our corporate social responsibility initiatives.

What will you need?

To start with, you need to be in the penultimate year of your studies. The subject of your degree is not important, but you will need an aptitude for maths, along with an inquisitive mindset and a creative approach to problem-solving. You should also be keen to develop your skills in coding and analysis.

Above all, we’re looking for people who thrive in a collaborative environment, which means working well with others, while also being focused on growth and development – yours and ours.

What’s in it for you

  • The chance to contribute to the future roadmap of our organisation

  • Exciting (and diverse) opportunities for career development

  • Outstanding learning and development through our Capital One University training programmes (and appropriate external providers)

  • Core benefits including a pension scheme, bonus, generous holidays and private medical insurance

  • Flexible benefits including season-ticket loans, cycle to work scheme and enhanced parental leave

  • Open-plan workspaces and accessible facilities designed to support and inspire you, including a fully serviced gym, subsidised restaurant, mindfulness and games rooms

The Recruitment Process

To ensure a flexible and accessible process, every stage will be conducted virtually. You'll also have a dedicated recruiter to support you throughout and answer any questions you might have.

Step 1: After your initial application, if you meet the hiring criteria you will be sent out online testing to complete, which consists of a situational and strengths, and a numerical and verbal reasoning assessment.

Step 2: Next up, you will be invited to complete a one way video interview.

Step 3: You’ll get to (virtually) meet with one of our Strategy Analysts to complete a case study interview.

Step 4: The assessment day, which consists of a group activity, case study and individual interview, and if successful we’ll offer you a place on the programme!

What you should know about how we recruit

We pride ourselves on hiring the best people, not the same people. Building diverse and inclusive teams is the right (and the smart) thing to do. We want to work with top talent: whoever you are, whatever you look like, wherever you come from. We know it’s about what you do, not just what you say. That’s why we make our recruitment process fair and accessible.

We also partner with organisations including the Women in Finance and Race At Work Charters, Stonewall and upReach to find people from every walk of life and help them thrive with us. We have a whole host of internal networks and support groups you could be involved in, to name a few:

  • REACH – Race Equality and Culture Heritage group focuses on representation, retention and engagement for associates from minority ethnic groups and allies

  • OutFront – to provide LGBTQ+ support for all associates

  • Mind Your Mind – signposting support and promoting positive mental wellbeing for all

  • Women in Tech – promoting an inclusive environment in tech

  • EmpowHER - network of female associates and allies focusing on developing future leaders, particularly for female talent in our industry

Capital One is committed to diversity in the workplace.

Where and how you'll work

This is a 10 week summer internship and is based in our Nottingham office.

We have a hybrid working model which gives you flexibility to work from our offices and from home. We’re big on collaboration and connection, so you’ll be based in our Nottingham office 3 days a week on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays.

Many of our associates have flexible working arrangements, and we’re open to talking about an arrangement that works for you.

Capital One is committed to diversity in the workplace.

If you require a reasonable adjustment, please contact ukrecruitment@capitalone.com All information will be kept confidential and will only be used for the purpose of applying a reasonable adjustment.

For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com

Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.

Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).


Who We Are

At Capital One, we're building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Location: Derby or Coleshill

The Role:

Our client is a Tier 1 Design and Build Engineering Contractor who are delivering one of the largest and most varied water infrastructure improvement programmes in the UK for Severn Trent Water.

They are looking to recruit a contract Power BI Developer to be based out of either their Derby or Coleshill offices to support these projects. The contract will be for 12 months+ with a day rate of £400.00 and this position has been determined to be inside IR35.

  • Understanding of data visualization best practices and report design principles
  • Project Controls reporting experience

title: Risk Analyst
description:
As one of the world's largest networks of audit, tax and consulting firms, RSM delivers big ideas and premium service to help middle-market businesses thrive. We are a fast-growing firm with big ambitions - we have a clear goal to become the premium adviser to the middle market, globally. This vision touches everything we do, motivating and inspiring us to become better every day. If you are looking for a firm where you can build a future and make an impact, then RSM is the place for you.


Risk and Governance Analyst

Get the career you want at RSM

Our analyst role will give you all the skills and support you need to unlock a future that’s packed with opportunities and new experiences.

When you join our team, you’ll enjoy a powerful combination of on-the-job learning and structured training – not to mention an impressive client list to work with. You’ll discover a culture that nurtures individuality and an environment where everyone is supported to reach their potential.

Job description

We are seeking enthusiastic, self-motivated and focused individuals to join our growing Insight4GRC team. We work with clients to introduce the cloud-based solution to enhance their governance, risk and compliance arrangements. To start with we would get you familiar with the Insight4GRC solution and you would support other team members with implementations, eventually leading to taking on responsibility for leading and project managing implementations yourself, delivering exceptional service to clients, and becoming part of a high performing team.

Our clients can vary between the public and corporate sector and you will work with them to implement and enable deployment of the Insight4GRC solution within their organisation to take full advantage of the benefits / agility that the cloud application brings. Our clients see us as a trusted advisor and you will work within the team to configure, migrate data, train and provide support on the Insight4GRC solution.

As part of your role, we will provide broad opportunities for development of both your Insight4GRC application and consulting skills.

Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

Configure the solution to meet the client needs;
Manage migration of existing client data into the solution;
Deliver training to enable the client to fully utilise functionality;
Provide support and expertise to existing clients to ensure they make the most of the solution.
Effectively prioritise whilst working on several projects, ranging in size;
Collaborate and communicate effectively with other members of the delivery team, including functional consultants, support desk team and senior management;
Record time accurately and promptly;
Continually striving to learn and develop skills and improve own performance;
Problem solving.

You will be part of a cohort that is building for the future, and you will be given further opportunities to train and develop your career at RSM.

What can you expect?

At RSM, you’ll be a key member of our team from day one. You’ll benefit from on-the-job training and ongoing support from colleagues and senior staff, gaining access to our internal training courses that will help you develop in the role. This hands-on early experience is invaluable as you take the next steps in your career.

What we look for

Technology qualifications are not a prerequisite. You will receive full training on Insigh4GRC and other business processes.

Essential
A passion for delivering real business value through technology;
Personal organisational and time management skills;
Strong verbal and written communication skills;
Well-developed interpersonal skills;
Excellent attention to detail;
Able to work under own initiative.

Desirable
General familiarity with software applications.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Outlook and Teams.

If that sounds like you, we know you’ll enjoy being part of our team.

Flexible working

At RSM we work hard to create an environment where our people can make a difference - to themselves, their career, their teams, and to the success of our firm and clients. We support all our people to work flexibly, to manage their family and other responsibilities alongside their work commitments; we believe this is key to achieving an inspiring and fulfilling working environment.

Our recruitment process

Please note, for those who perform well throughout our assessment process, should your first preference be unavailable, you could potentially be offered a role in another location or department. This would always be discussed with you in this instance.

RSM will only take one application into consideration per recruitment cycle. We do not accept multiple applications to different vacancies.


Entry requirements

At RSM, we don't just look for good exam results. We think passion, personality and originality are just as important.

You will need:

96 UCAS points across 3 A Levels or an equivalent level 3 qualification, or 104 UCAS points across 4 Scottish Highers/Advanced Highers or Irish Leaving Certificate (Higher Level);

For all roles outside of Central London, we require successful candidates to have obtained both a full UK driving licence and regular access to a vehicle by the time they come to the end of their 6-month settling in period with RSM. For London roles access to a car is desirable but not essential.”

Please note, RSM does not accept General Studies, AS levels or the Extended Project Qualification (EPQ).


Diversity and Inclusion at RSM
At RSM, we want to create a strong sense of belonging so that people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures feel they can bring their true self to work. Our clients come from all walks of life. We aim to achieve that same diversity of background, experience and perspective in our own teams, so that we can genuinely understand our client's needs. Diverse teams bring a broader range of ideas and insights to work. That's why we're working together to ensure our firm's principles and processes support a firm culture that embraces difference and strengthens inclusion.
At RSM we work hard to create an environment where our people can make a difference - to themselves, their career, their teams, and to the success of our firm and clients. We support all our people to work flexibly, to manage their family and other responsibilities alongside their work commitments; we believe this is key to achieving an inspiring and fulfilling working environment.

title: Business Coordinator
description:
Retail is constantly evolving, which is why we have a diverse Global Business Coordination (GBC) department.

It is our job to think about how we can improve our customers lives, evolve the business, and prepare for the future on an international scale.

We use state-of-the-art technology to bring about digital change that delivers real customer value, internal efficiency and new customer experiences.

This is an opportunity for you to have a truly global impact on our business, driving innovative propositions and services to provide our customers with new and exciting ways to shop and improving the overall customer journey.


Our Global Business Coordination department is responsible for anticipating, identifying, and responding to changes within a constantly evolving retail industry. This is a chance for you to have a global impact by delivering impactful research to inform global decision making and drive a consumer-centric culture.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Consumer Research Analyst to join our expanding team. You will play an important part in the continued development of Aldi South’s global vision for Customer Experience.

You will help to ensure we put our customers at the heart of decisions to improve our market share and create new business opportunities.

You will be confident collating and distilling multiple data sources, to tell a clear and compelling story to inspire business change. You will be a key part of improving customer experience at ALDI on a global scale, transforming the business and preparing for the future.

The Research Analyst will be UK based, but part of a global team, therefore some travel on demand should be expected, as per the needs of the project, or upon request of the Consumer & Market Research Manager.

If you would like to join our dynamic team and thrive working in a fast-paced environment, apply to join #TeamAldi today!

Your New Role:


  • You will be responsible for identifying consumer trends, and unmet needs for multiple markets
  • Lead and deliver in-house qualitative and quantitative research studies
  • Brief and project manage research conducted through third parties
  • Design and socialise impactful deliverables to communicate key findings
  • Present research recommendations to Senior Leadership
  • Build and maintain strong and collaborative relationships with National Research Teams
  • Proactively identify opportunities to add additional value through Consumer Research

About You:

  • As a Research Analyst you will have experience in planning, designing & executing quantitative research studies
  • The successful candidate will have experience in creating compelling insights to influence senior stakeholders
  • Ability to build strong working relationships, anticipate stakeholder needs & manage expectations
  • High attention to detail & data accuracy
  • Ability to ask the right questions and identify the most effective research methods to solve business problems
  • Strong communication & presentation skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and effectively prioritise conflicting requirements
  • Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
  • Experience in planning, designing and executing qualitative research studies would be advantageous, but not essential
  • Experience in securing budget and buy-in for research
  • Experience in a new / emerging in-house research team
  • Ability to successfully mentor / upskill junior team members on research best practice
  • Awareness and understanding of secondary research resources
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

What you will get in Return:


  • Salary starting from £52,985 rising to £61,030
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working
  • The opportunity to travel to ALDI South countries as required
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • Flexible working hours
  • Full training provided with ongoing personal development opportunities
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • A variety of Aldi Perks including bike to work scheme, discounted gym passes, accommodation, travel, cinema and family day out tickets
  • Access to a free, 24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)

If you’re ready to join a forward thinking business with a focus on your development as well as the business, apply today!

Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect

title: Test Analyst
description:
Type – Contract
Rate – Circa £65.00 per hour Umbrella Co
Duration – 6 Months +
Hours – Typically 38 hours per week
Determination – Inside IR35
Security – UK BPSS Security Clearance to be in place
Location – Leicester, UK
Start Date – ASAP !

Description:
UK NATIONAL FROM BIRTH ONLY

Working closely with the other Test Analysts/Senior Testers/Project Members

Location Leceister
Overview Reporting to the Test Lead as part of the delivery team, the Test Analyst is responsible for supporting the Test Team with test documentation and execution

Job Purpose Summary
The role will predominantly be supporting the test function spanning Oracle, .Net technologies and customer portfolio.
This includes a full spectrum of current products and services, including Collaborative Working Environment (CWE), Sharepoint, E&AM, Commercial systems and Advanced data analytics and visualisation tools.
The role is required to provide support of the testing solutions to the Test Team including working with the Test Analysts, and Test Lead closely with good communication skills.
Our development teams use a range of lifecycle models including Waterfall and Agile practices. Importantly, our testers are working alongside developers as part of the same team because we believe better collaboration leads to better quality.
This combined with the demands of a commercial software operation means it is essential that the successful candidate is enthusiastic about quality whilst retaining the focus on delivering a fit for purpose solution to the customer within time, cost and quality constraints.

Responsibilities Key responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively within the teams to support all testing activities required
  • Support in the specifying, designing and executing manual functional and non-functional testing required specified to demonstrate that a correct level of quality has been achieved
  • Work well with the internal Project teams showing respect and listening to what is required
  • Ensure the testing principles and processes are consistently followed
  • Report directly to the Test Lead with progress and challenges
  • Work in a manner conducive to building positive and constructive relationships with all colleagues in particular those working in development and service delivery teams and key business stakeholders
  • Contribute to the continual progression of testing using any of your key skillsets

Line Manager Responsibilities
To encourage and support the team and support the Test Analyst development within the team
Key Performance Indicators

  • Respect of colleagues and peers
  • Completing tasks and deliverables in accordance with time, cost and quality requirements/expectations
  • Communicating status of work, in a concise and informative format
  • Contributing to required working or special interest groups.
  • Ensuring all mandatory training is up to date
Evidencing Success
  • Contributes supporting to improving the department and its practices
  • Positive relations with colleagues and customers where applicable
  • Demonstrating and adopting a Risk based approach to testing
  • Working as part of the Team
  • To be able to work individually

title: Customer Insights Analyst
description:
INFO

SALARY:

£55000 - £60000

LOCATION

Coventry

JOB TYPE

Permanent

SENIOR ANALYST

COVENTRY

£55,000-£60,000 + BENEFITS

THE COMPANY

This UK-based brand has recently built a digital transformation area that operates as an internal consultant to the wider business. You will work in tandem with the product managers to build data products to support wider business objectives. They are based in Coventry and have flexible working to WFH 3x a week.

THE ROLE

As a Senior Analyst, you will work cross-functionally as well as with wider business stakeholders.

Some of your main responsibilities will be:

  • Supporting the wider business with solutions to data problems.
  • You will build dashboards and reports and present these to wider stakeholders and talk through insights to support business decisions.
  • Use of SQL and Tableau to work on projects.
  • Communicate to senior stakeholders around the business, building those relationships and being a solid member of the digital transformation team.
  • Line manage and mentor junior people.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

A successful Senior Analyst will have:

  • Experience in a consultancy environment would be highly advantageous but not required.
  • Experience working in SQL and data visualisation is a must.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to build relationships.
  • Educated to a master's level or above in a STEM subject.

THE BENEFITS

  • A salary of £55,000-£60,000.
  • Broad exposure to an exciting range of projects.
  • Work with a lot of highly talented individuals.
  • Comprehensive bonus and benefits package.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Lydia via the apply link on this page.

CONTACT

Lydia Morfett-Murdock

Business Manager

title: Operations Analyst
description:
At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe.

HOW YOU WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE

About you:

Do you want to spend your working time making a difference in the world around you? Are you motivated by impactful work? Do you have a passion for master data, and systems? If so, then a career with STERIS in our Supply Chain Division could be a great fit for you!

About Us:

At STERIS we are a leading global provider of products and services that support patient care with an emphasis on infection prevention. Our mission is to help our customers create a healthier and safer world. Working at STERIS, you GROW, LEARN and MAKE A DIFFERENCE.

We are currently recruiting for an Operations Analyst. This is an excellent opportunity to join us at a skilled level in a division that drives the business forward through Supply Chain Management.

The Operations Analyst is responsible for the generation, analysis, and delivery of Operations metrics, reporting, and recommendations across Europe. The analyst will work closely with IT, Supply Chain, and Manufacturing teams to support all departmental reporting needs.

Duties

  • Analyze data reporting requirements within a business process and facilitate report development and validation
  • Analyze workflows, business processes and applications to enhance, automate and expedite process improvements
  • Serve as strategic partner between IT, Supply Chain and Manufacturing
  • Review, analyze, evaluate, and document business requirements
  • Assist with documenting and tracking project progress and interacts regularly with key stakeholders and process owners while serving as a project liaison when needed to meet established timelines
  • Provide support on special or re-occurring ad hoc projects as requested from within the organization.
  • Development of thoughtful analytics and delivery of meaningful insights driven by data as required by the business.
  • Completes project deliverables, i.e. functional requirements, training material, communication content etc.
  • Manages resolution of cross-functional issues and demonstrates appropriate judgment regarding when to escalate issues to leadership.

Duties - cont'd

  • Interacts with cross-functional teams and third parties to deliver various business solutions.
  • Partners with IT and the business to define solutions and requirements
  • Identifies deficiencies in Supply Chain workflows and creates acceptable alternative processes.
  • Assists in interpreting and analyzing data flows between manufacturing systems, data warehouse, Cognos, and Smoothie.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Education Degree

  • Associate's Degree

Required Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in MIS, Business, Supply Chain or related field required.
  • 2+ years of Business Analyst experience
  • Strong Advanced Excel skills is required
  • Knowledge of MS Office Suite is required.

Preferred Experience

  • Understanding of databases and experience working with transact SQL or similar database reporting systems or query tools is preferred
  • Experience working with Oracle, Cognos, Tableau is preferred

Skills

  • Proficient at problem-solving
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities; self-directed
  • Ability to work independently

STERIS is a leading provider of products and services that meet the needs of growth areas within Healthcare: procedures, devices, vaccines and biologics. We exist to fulfill our MISSION TO HELP OUR CUSTOMERS CREATE A HEALTHIER AND SAFER WORLD. STERIS is a $3B, publicly traded (NYSE: STE) company with approximately 16,000 associates and Customers in more than 100 countries.

STERIS strives to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Technical Analyst
description:
You will be responsible for

Primary liaison between the Research and Development Team and the business, as well as distributors and end users; responsible for all activities related to successful capture and documentation of requirements for commercially viable solutions. Leading an iterative approach to discussions with stakeholders to ensure the creation and sign-off of agreed specifications and acceptance criteria. Presenting and reviewing documentation within the R & D team to assist in the evaluation of timescales and costs for identified deliverables.

Providing a high level of accuracy in fact-finding, utilizing the product and technical expertise, asking the questions required, providing suitable suggestions, and where appropriate alternatives, to successfully compile the baseline material required for development activities and decision making.

Detailed discussion throughout the process with the Technical Support, Commercial and Training Teams to support successful data exchange, facilitating a common understanding between all parties with the ability to ensure the intent of the requirement and how best to deliver it is fully understood and agreed upon by all.


You will need

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in Business Analyst or related Product Development role
  • Expert communication and documentation skills
  • Strong analytical skillset and prior experience of workflow analysis, business process engineering and acceptance criteria creation
  • Demonstratable experience in product engineering roles contributing in a technical capacity to successful product delivery
  • Demonstratable experience in working as part of a successful agile product development team
  • Expert MS Office skills

Responsibilities:

  • Documenting acceptance criteria and project documentation in support of agile product developments concerning mechanical, electronic and software development teams and activities
  • Research and evaluate product/opportunity requirements, working closely with commercial stakeholders, system architects, product owners and development engineers to ensure common understanding of requirement intent, context and best possible options for delivery
  • Working with Quality Assurance and Project Management teams to ensure products are validated to meet the intended use; including Product Owners and other stakeholders to develop and execute the required test plans
  • Facilitating evaluation of products by stakeholders, internal “beta” tests, and prototype builds for the purpose of collecting user feedback, assessing viability and driving refinement and evolution of the requirements and the product range as a whole
  • Assisting Training and Marketing teams in creation and maintenance of product documentation

Position Description:

  • Documenting acceptance criteria and project documentation in support of agile product developments concerning mechanical, electronic and software development teams and activities
  • Research and evaluate product/opportunity requirements, working closely with commercial stakeholders, system architects, product owners and development engineers to ensure common understanding of requirement intent, context and best possible options for delivery
  • Working with Quality Assurance and Project Management teams to ensure products are validated to meet the intended use; including Product Owners and other stakeholders to develop and execute the required test plans
  • Facilitating evaluation of products by stakeholders, internal “beta” tests, and prototype builds for the purpose of collecting user feedback, assessing viability and driving refinement and evolution of the requirements and the product range as a whole
  • Assisting Training and Marketing teams in creation and maintenance of product documentation

SupplyPoint provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. SupplyPoint complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

title: Test Analyst
description:
Type – Contract
Rate – Circa £50.00 per hour OR PAYE equivalent (DOE)
Duration – 12 Months +
Hours – Typically 38 hours per week
Determination – Inside IR35
Security – UK BPSS Security Clearance to be in place
Location – Leicester, UK
Start Date – ASAP ?

Description:


Is Job Title Test Analyst
Department Technology
Reports to Test Lead

Working closely with the other Test Analysts/Senior Testers/Project Members

Grade Dependent upon experience

Overview;

Reporting to the Test Lead as part of the delivery team, the Test Analyst is responsible for supporting the Test Team with test documentation and execution

Job Purpose Summary;
The role will predominantly be supporting the test function spanning Oracle, .Net technologies and customer portfolio.

This includes a full spectrum of current products and services, including Collaborative Working Environment (CWE), Sharepoint, E&AM, Commercial systems and Advanced data analytics and visualisation tools.
The role is required to provide support of the testing solutions to the Test Team including working with the Test Analysts, and Test Lead closely with good communication skills.

Our development teams use a range of lifecycle models including Waterfall and Agile practices. Importantly, our testers are working alongside developers as part of the same team because we believe better collaboration leads to better quality.

This combined with the demands of a commercial software operation means it is essential that the successful candidate is enthusiastic about quality whilst retaining the focus on delivering a fit for purpose solution to the customer within time, cost and quality constraints.

Responsibilities Key responsibilities:
  • Work collaboratively within the teams to support all testing activities required
  • Support in the specifying, designing and executing manual functional and non-functional testing required specified to demonstrate that a correct level of quality has been achieved
  • Work well with the internal Project teams showing respect and listening to what is required
  • Ensure the testing principles and processes are consistently followed
  • Report directly to the Test Lead with progress and challenges
  • Work in a manner conducive to building positive and constructive relationships with all colleagues in particular those working in development and service delivery teams and key business stakeholders
  • Contribute to the continual progression of testing using any of your key skillsets

Line Manager Responsibilities
To encourage and support the team and support the Test Analyst development within the team
Key Performance Indicators • Respect of colleagues and peers
  • Completing tasks and deliverables in accordance with time, cost and quality requirements/expectations
  • Communicating status of work, in a concise and informative format
  • Contributing to required working or special interest groups.
  • Ensuring all mandatory training is up to date
Evidencing Success
  • Contributes supporting to improving the department and its practices
  • Positive relations with colleagues and customers where applicable
  • Demonstrating and adopting a Risk based approach to testing
  • Working as part of the Team
  • To be able to work individually

Personal Attributes/Behaviours;

To be successful in this role the following attributes and behaviours are required to be demonstrated:
  • A positive attitude and a“ can do” approach to work
  • Flexible and adaptable
  • Communication and interpersonal skills – ability to foster effective professional relationships with others
  • Team work and the ability to interact effectively in teams
  • Contributing to the continual improvement of the testing process and working practices where relevant
  • Able to self-learn and apply self-governance
  • Tenacious and resilient
  • Enthusiasm and a passion for testing
  • Strong Innovative and creative thinking
  • Strong Problem solving ability
  • Analytical
  • Adheres to Babcock Marine standards and practices

Basic Qualifications;
  • Previous experience in software testing roles especially using complex systems
  • Suitable Software Testing qualification
  • Good positive attitude
  • Team Player

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Our Incora Story is really taking off – we’d love you to join us for the journey

We are currently seeking an exceptional professional to join us as a Senior Data Analyst (Derby/Poland).

As a Senior Data Analyst you will support our Supply Chain function by providing first-class, reporting and analysis skills to our stakeholders.

You will be a key part of our organisation, ensuring analysis of information is translated into meaningful data that can be used to improve the profitability of Incora.

About You

You will be a resilient strong communicator, exceptional at working with large numbers, with a background in Supply Chain. Some experience of managing people is preferable.

Advanced excel skills are a must for this role, along with a knowledge of MRP/ERP systems and an understanding of planning. This role requires a good level of reporting and an ability to translate that data to enable meaningful conversations with both internal and external stakeholders. Also, improving existing reporting methodologies utilizing latest technologies such as Qlikview and Power BI for efficient data processing.

We are interested in people with a mathematics background (a degree in this area is preferable but not essential) with around two years’ experience of working in an analytics environment where excellence is at the heart of what you do.

Most importantly you will be passionate about our Incora Values and exceeding customer expectations.

· Courage Take ownership for issues and problems.

· Collaboration Share knowledge and experience with others

· Commitment – Focus on ensuring internal and external customer expectations are met in a timely way.

In return we will offer the things that matter

· Starting salary between £35,000 to £40,000 dependent on experience

· We want you to share in the success of Incora, so every employee is eligible for one of our incentive programs.

· We want you to enjoy life as well as work so we offer great holiday benefits such as 25 days holiday plus 8 bank holidays with a holiday buying scheme with the ability to buy up to 5 additional days

· We want you to have peace of mind regarding your future with our generous Company pension scheme including 4 times salary life cover

· We want to help you look after you and your family by providing Health cash plans saving you money and helping you to stay well

· We want to support you and the people that matter to you with our flexible working and family friendly policies and practices

· Incora cares about our environmental impact and that’s why we reward people who use green transport to travel to work with our Green Travel Allowance

· We believe every little helps by offering a generous discount portal only available to Incora employees

· Very importantly we want to be with you to help your career take off and become part of the Incora Story

So, if you feel you have all of this, and want to be part of developing the Incora Story apply now we can’t wait to hear from you

We are passionate about Diversity & Inclusion and we welcome applications from all persons regardless of their age, race, gender, disability, religion/belief, or sexual orientation.

Incora™ is a leading, global provider of innovative supply chain solutions. Our promise to our customers is to reduce complexity and increase reliability so they can deliver mission-critical solutions that improve our world. We exist to enable the mission critical.

With a strong foundation in the aerospace and defence markets, we also utilize our expertise to serve industrial manufacturing, marine, pharmaceuticals, and beyond. We manage all aspects of supply chain from procurement to warehouse management, from logistics to on-site customer services.

We pride ourselves on offering:

· Industry-leading capabilities

· Innovative solutions

· Greater customer value

· Trusted supplier relationships

· Business growth and operational efficiency

Incora requests that recruitment agencies do not speculatively submit CVs to any employee or associate of our company unless explicitly asked to do so by a member of our Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Manager for a particular role. Any CVs sent to an Incora employee on a speculative basis will not be recognised and we will not accept liability for any fee or commission, should we subsequently employ a candidate who applied to us directly or was introduced by a member of our Talent Acquisition Team.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £35,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Yearly bonus

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Derby, DE24 8UJ

Reference ID: VN3109

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Full-time
    Employee Status: Regular
    Role Type: Hybrid
    Department: Finance
    Schedule: Full Time

Company Description

Discover the Unexpected

Experian is the world’s leading global information services company. We’re passionate about unlocking the power of data in order to transform lives and create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. For more than 125 years, we’ve helped economies and communities flourish – and we’re not done.

Our 21k amazing employees in 40+ countries believe the possibilities for you, and the world, are growing. We’re investing in the future, through new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow. To do this we employ the brightest minds that share our purpose and want to make a difference.

Job Description

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join a fast-paced, delivery-focused team as we venture into the next phase of a major programme of work, transforming the billing capabilities of a firmly established, market-leading B2B business as part of a wider Lead to Cash transformation programme. This role requires someone who has experience of highly transactional billing environments and is adept at working across delivery methodologies to understand our client and business needs, define use cases and work with a cross-functional team of experts to help deliver the vision.

Why this role is important to us

Working as part of the Billing Centre of Excellence, the BA will have strong communication and rapport-building skills, acting as the conduit between the customer and business needs and the supporting tech, data and capability development teams. The ability to translate complex needs into functional requirements in conjunction with the solution owners and support the product owner with prioritisation and refinement of the backlog with a hands-on approach is highly desirable.

Work that matters - What you’ll be doing

  • Assists in the analysis of stakeholder objectives, and the underlying issues arising from investigations into business requirements and problems and identifies options for consideration.
  • Works iteratively with stakeholders, to identify and measure potential benefits, available options for consideration, and to help define acceptance tests.
  • Supports operational readiness activity and handing over of systems and processes into BAU.
  • Create documents as required, in particular Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM), Business Requirements Documents, Process Maps.
  • Effective planning and prioritisation skills to manage team tasks in an appropriate way to deliver on project commitments
  • An awareness of current technological trends coupled with a strong business acumen.
  • A software development or data analysis background or experience in engaging with software development teams and test teams is desirable but not essential.
  • Experience in working with offshore or outsourced development teams and third-party suppliers is desirable but not essential
  • Ability to influence stakeholders and challenge effectively, focusing on making future-proof decisions.
  • Works collaboratively, leads by example and inspires the trust of others

Qualifications

What you’ll need to bring to the role & Experian
Critical Experience:

  • Driving workshops and requirement elicitation
  • Strong stakeholder engagement and influencing skills
  • Understanding of billing technologies, processes and data management
  • Data analysis skills
  • Experience in Billing Processes and understanding of Systems, Payments processing and Revenue Assurance processes and solution implementation
  • Experience leading as Business Analyst and strong functional knowledge of Billing Solutions, processes and operations

Desirable Experience:

  • Working within a regulated environment
  • Large-scale, B2B environment
  • Complex data environment
  • Multiple product environment
  • Exposure to systems analysis and design
  • Understanding of agile and waterfall delivery methodologies
  • Good understanding of the end-to-end Prospect to Cash processes and solutions concepts
  • Project Management experience would be useful – ideally with PMP/PRINCE2 Certification

More about you

As a minimum the candidate will be proficient in the following:

  • Oral and written communication skills
  • Interpersonal and consultative skills
  • Facilitation skills
  • Analytical thinking and problem solving
  • Being detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
  • Organisational skills
  • Knowledge of business structure
  • Cost benefit analysis
  • Processes modelling

Everyone has different experience, and so please don’t rule yourself out if you cannot ‘tick’ all of the qualities mentioned above. Talk to us about the experience that you do have.

Additional Information

Our uniqueness is that we truly celebrate yours.

Experian's culture and people are key differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously. We focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. We’re an award winning organisation due to our strong people first approach.

Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together
